puss in boots the last wish is the decadelater sequel to a spinoff franchise and yet it is the best movie in the shrek franchise thats no small feat when it has to match up against shrek 2 everything about this movie pushes the boundaries on how we view animated family movies from a message about coming to terms with our own mortality to humor that doesnt talk down to its viewers with 3 different kinds of antagonists the movie is able to make sure none are too hot or too cold striking that balance of just right across the board even a character like perro who you would expect to be the annoying comedic relief is a fun side character who contributes to the themes and flow of the story this movie was an incredible surprise that ensures that puss will always be our favorite fearless hero

a sequel to puss in boots being considered a cinematic masterpiece is a shocker and i absolutely agree everything from the incredible animation to the compelling story  and the amazing performance from the voice actors its a non stop ride of action emotion comedy and i cant stress enough how amazing this film is chefs kiss and i hope this is the direction dreamworks goes for shrek 5

this film is fantastic in every way the animation is beautiful the comedy is spectacular and the movie is scary funny sad and exciting at the same time    all the characters are so fun and unique everyone is giving it their all and it is incredible    there are a lot of cameos from other character out of the shrek franchise that are very fun to see on the big screen again    there are great surprises sprinkled throughout that will excite and entertain you    last but not least this film has a surprising amount of dark moments and a wolf character that will maybe scare you    overall the movie is awesome     if you want a movie for the whole family to watch and enjoy in the theater then this one is perfect

puss in boots returns for a sequel with the hugest bang possible with a whole new animation design that resembles closely to spiderverse  tmnt the last wish made every fan rejoiced with its sense of humour and amazing choreography matching to none the film succeeded in doing something what dreamworks is known for targeting at mature audiences with topics as death depression etc it really is a dreamworks writing through and through the films major bonus point is the addition of most beloved fairy tale characters and showing their darker and gritty sides which really puts a new perspective in the minds of people who have grown up watching such titles the story explores the last life of puss which really puts a spin on what it means to live a life knowing there is no coming back   all in all  a great film that made me love dreamworks even more  hopeful in the future installments    pros  amazing cinematography and animation  great villain and characters arc  a complete and unique story  cons  some story points that feels to repetitive of the first movie but still blends in really well

lets go with the minuses  i was surprised by the level of violence portrayed in the movie at times its also quite loomingly scary with the characters of wolf played by wagner moura and big jack horner john mulaney being very violent wolf also occupies a very weird place in the film  i remained unclear if he was supposed to be a representation of death or death itself the new animation style was interesting but didnt really seem to serve a real purpose except for it being there    however these are quite minor and the movie itself is quite well put together with logical reasons for each of the characters to look for the wish maybe except kitty but its a small thing in the grand scheme of things perrito voiced by harvey guillen and goldilocks played by sheseverywhere florence pugh are interesting additions to the storyline the humour is also quite well done though again might fly over the kids heads and it was an enjoyable movie     overall a good movie though keep it for the older kids

i personally believe this movie is great i love all of the different styles of animation its similar to spider verse and mutant mayhem i love the villians and there separate personalities i think goldilocks and the bears had a great ark and were very thought out characters jack horner had me dying while watching this movie he was so funny always talking about ruling the planet and last but not least death was one of the best villians in any movie i have ever watched even with deaths small aperance in the movie he built fear the movie can portray this in the beginning when puss defeats a giant it shows how strong he is but as soon as he meets death and death makes a threat it makes the audience think puss will win when puss ends out not winning and even getting scraped it puts a sense of fear into the audience and puss it in general makes deaths presence so unsettling from his non blinking eyes to him being everywhere at once death is a great villian puss is puss and kitty is kitty i forgot the dogs name but he was great and was hilarious

if youre a fan of adventure humor and daring heroes then puss in boots the last wish is the movie for you this film takes everything we love about the swashbuckling feline and adds a new layer of depth and emotion to his story    the animation is absolutely stunning with vibrant colors and beautifully rendered landscapes that transport you right into the world of puss in boots the voice acting is superb with antonio banderas once again bringing his signature charm and wit to the character of puss and the supporting cast including the sly and cunning big bad wolf are all perfectly cast and bring their own unique flair to the story    but what really sets puss in boots the last wish apart is the emotional journey that our hero goes on we see him struggle with the consequences of his adventurous lifestyle and confront his own mortality in a way that is both heartwarming and thoughtprovoking and yet even in the face of his own mortality puss never loses his sense of humor or his indomitable spirit    puss in boots the last wish is a fivestar adventure that will leave you on the edge of your seat in tears but with a smile on your face whether youre a longtime fan of the series or just looking for a fun and exciting family movie this one is not to be missed

this film is an exciting thrill ride of a film that your whole family will enjoy this film is a fun adventure across the shrek universe that has lots of references to the original shrek films the story is action packed and fast paced with lots of fun and interesting references to old fairy tales like pinocchio little jack horner and goldilocks and the three bears this will make teenagers reflect on their childhoods and feel nostalgic also the adventure that our main characters take it will keep you on the edge of your seat as they go on a long journey to get to the dark forest and then traverse that forest which is a new and colourful location this movie has some outstanding characters such puss in boots he is a fun funny and a complex character who at first doesnt take care of his lives until he learns at the end of the film why you should spend your life in the best way you can alongside puss we have kitty soft paws who wants the wish to find someone who she can trust perito is a fun sidekick that helps kitty and puss get their wishes without magic goldilocks learns an important lesson about family she tells her bear family that she wants a real family instead of living in a family of bears but she learns that she should love the family she has with the art style in this film are taking a lot of inspiration from one of my favourite movies of all time called spiderman into the spidey verse this film has an art style similar to comic book and the main character of the film miles loves comics so it also kind of fits with the movie back to puss in boots the visual look is done with a paint brush which makes this movie look aesthetically pleasing to its audience now on to the music every single song fits the theme of the scene that you are watching it goes from the banger opening with the song fearless hero to the wolfs whistling theme which is ominous and adds a level of fear to this mysterious wolf this is why the art and music of this film makes it stand out significantly to the over films dreamworks has released over the years overall this film is worth a watch 910

pib 2 puss in boots 2 aka puss in boots the last wish is an absolute mustsee from the opening song describing our fearless hero all the way to the end of the film at the site of the wishing star pib 2 left me laughing and crying and feeling everything in between this sequel to a spinoff of a sequel to the original shrek movie had me laughing and crying how did this happen the characters were extremely memorable for one big jack horner was a great intentionally onedimensional villain and the character of death was truly terrifying the comic relief perrito a small abandoned puppy stole the show this movie would have been pretty good with out perrito but with perrito it was great one of the best scenes in the movie had to have been when puss is having a incredibly realistic panic attack and perrito is able to do what hes always wanted to do be a therapy dog for his friend this substance in storytelling wasnt the only thing that made this movie great its style was also phenomenal based on the style of spiderman into the spiderverse this film dazzles with its color palette direction and dropped frame rate during key moments of intensity but by far the great element of this movie was just how funny and entertaining it was pib 2 is a mustsee if you havent already seen it

finally watched the next instalment in the shrek universe puss in boots the last wish this film is one of my favorite animated films of all time now    to be completely honest i watched this film only for the antagonist but i was pleasantly surprised by all the supporting characters yes all the characters it is a rarity to find great supporting characters in animated films unfortunately but this film breaks that stereotype all of them have something to offer to the story and the themes my favorites were perrito goldi and of course death    the conflict  the resolution and the ending in my opinion are just perfection because i cannot think of anything better than what i actually saw moving to the technical aspects the animation was spectacular the best in the universe i couldnt take my eyes off of the screen and the design of death was the besti watched a video about his design which made me appreciate the character even more the music was pretty cool too especially deaths whistle which was creepy as hell and i assure you that it will haunt you forever    coming to the negatives i kind of found it difficult to get immersed into the world during the initial 20 minutes but when i understood the theme of the film i got right into it that would be my only complaint    finally puss in boots is a really mature animated film and has to be the best from the universe yet

puss in boots the last wish  1010 what a lovely surprise this sequel to the iconic character puss in boots see puss having to deal with the idea of death being an iconic cat burglar cat he must come to terms with the fact that he is at his last life and that he must try to find a special wish granting thing to help him get his lives back in check along the way he ends up making new and old friends and realizes that he doesnt need 9 lives rather he just needs the one to understand how beautiful life is and what a beautiful film in general a mature family friendly film dealing with the idea of death and how we must enjoy the life we have regardless of what may come in the future also made me a little teary eyed while watching it awesome movie and definitely recommend

whilst i enjoyed the first puss in boots 12 years ago no one was pining for a sequel especially with the shrek ip having cooled off in the meantime so i had little expectations or intention to see it when it arrived in the cinemas last year kudos then to its writing and directing team to find the courage and a fresh angle to tackle this which manages to reinvigorate an old perhaps even onenote character and brings pathos and some fantastically rendered visuals to go with it that almost made me wish i had seen it on a bigger screen refocusing and reimagining antonio banderass puss as an existential character facing his own mortality after squandering 8 of his 9 lives within a fairytale world where goldilocks and the 3 bears cheekily voiced by florence pugh olivia colman and ray winstone are a cockney crime family and john mulaneys jack horner represents the big corporate baddie the story is essentially one extended wacky racestyle chase to get a wish from a fallen star in an enchanted forest where the visual department is unleashed to delightfully creative effects now i get why quite rightly so this was nominated for an oscar earlier this year

im laughing because i didnt expect to enjoy it so much i cannot believe i am about to write such a genuine and indepth on freaking puss in boots of all movies   firstly puss in boots the last wish had the trademark unbelievable wit and humor of the previous movies with john mulaney as one of the voice actors the already hilarious script became so much better     the character arc was incredible although i may be biased as a sucker for the arrogant character and his romantic dynamic with kitty was one of the most enjoyable straight romances ive seen recently it was just imperfect and genuine enough while also being wellbalanced as a friendship and partnership   perrito of course is impossible not to love and maintains a complicated story despite the initial comedic relief impression he gives the multiple dimensions to the characters was an instant green flag for this film    ive seen this talked about a lot and the way they conveyed a panic attack in puss was perfectly executed in my opinion not simply with the way his friends and himself handled the anxiety but they artistic choices as well  ill admit this is what i wanted to talk about the most i was so impressed i wanted to cry ive seen the style used here popping up in more places over the past few years one example being spiderman into the spiderverse where they play with 2d and 3d designs frame rates and camera angles to shake up the conventional cgi animation that combined with the beautiful color schemes and auditory techniques such as the ringing and muffled sounds whenever a character is struck hard or dissociating made for a gorgeously immersive experience the use of visual symmetry and dynamics such as all the characters at different points of the star made it all the more satisfying    i dont need to point out how cleverly death was designed but im already on a roll so why not his design with the ghostlywhiteversusblack color pallet paired with his twin scythes lended themselves to the traditional reaper technique but there were so many more clever details the way his eyes flashed the haunting whistle and his unnervingly normal voice and demeanor were all techniques that made such a brilliant villain    finally i noticed much more linguistic representation in this movie it may seem small but personally even as an american who can just barely speak spanish seeing most of the characters alternate between english and fluent spanish added cultural representation i didnt know i needed to see it made me so happy to see and in my opinion added yet another layer to the characters in the movie    i have to reiterate i did not expect to be so impressed and delighted by this movie im almost embarrassed to be writing this review with the same vocabulary and conviction as a damn college essay but knowing that good animation and storytelling is still thriving is really all i care about now i just have to convince my family to watch it

ive been looking into florence pughs filmography and realized she has a small part in this movie ordinarily i wanted to skip this never being a fan of the shrek movies but this is a spinoff it doesnt have mike meyers and eddie murphys annoying voiceovers plus i do enjoy antonio banderas movies from time to time not to mention disney is in a bad place so why not check out the competition    puss in boots the jovial adventurer from the shrek sequel has gone forward since those early days with his spinoff but after nearly ten years he returns for a sequel the brave cat ends up magically dying and coming back to life only to be told that he is on the last of his nine lives and should retire from his adventures but this is puss in boots and if there is an opportunity to start over again he will take it when a magical power known as the wishing star map has been found and he wants his nine lives back but there are others in his way from foes to friends on the way to redeem the wishing stars wish    as i mentioned before i am not a fan of the shrek series but i love puss in boots banderas chews the scenery with his voice as the legendary feline hero alongside plenty of other voiceovers from salma hayek ray winstone and florence pugh i got to say that dreamworks makes a great movie better than anything disney is making nowadays

this movie is an absolute must watch puss in boots the last wish gives everything in a movie that i can ask for a great plot characters and growth of the main character a great sequel for my extended review i will speak on aspects of the movie so if you do not want to be spoiled please do not read first i would like to talk about puss and his growth as a character i absolutely love the way puss goes from a prideful arrogant and irresponsible cat to something more mature and less reckless  he learns that he is not indestructible and that he feels fear through this realization puss does not run away from his problems anymore and decides to instead go head first into his biggest fear death which leads me to my second aspect of the film the antagonist in the movie there is a bundle of side antagonist who actually have a purpose and fit the story well each with their own motives and the writers did a great job explaining what they were after and why in such a short time the lead antagonist death was by far the best aspect of not only the film but also the development of puss he shows that puss is both vulnerable and scared which leads him to face his fears and fight death head on such a great antagonist to a great film i would suggest leaving the franchise as it is and to not make a third movie so that they cant potentially ruin everything the second movie brought to the table a must see movie

puss in boots is for the most part a character that grew up with his audience     with this sequel coming out an entire decade after its predecessor people definitely were not expecting this release     its a rare thing when a sequel especially a spinoff sequel is met with open arms from audiences from sightings of a mere trailer let alone an actual viewing     puss in boots has a gorgeous stylisation with a unique blend of 2d and 3d animation that makes use of bold strokes both within the literal art style and within the story beats themselves even the camera direction and angles used alongside the editing is something that seriously lends to the viewing experience    with unique character designs and bold oversaturated use of colours puss in boots the last wish is a film that isnt afraid to lean into its painterly and cartoonish roots to help convey mood and emotion within scenes in a way that does not in any way retract from the experience it alternatively lifts the viewing experience up immensely with the way in which it is done     its a film that evokes unexpected emotion from the viewer with scenes that tackle real life issues such as mental health struggles and even the concept of mortality and existential dread with a realistic and raw approach in a fashion typically not explored or portrayed in these styles of movie atleast not with the level of care and toneappropriate humour the film manages to utilise without denoting the character struggles    this film also uses an interesting story telling mechanic employed by having several characters within it that one could consider the true antagonist of the film depending on either the viewers perspective or the time within the story as it progresses the villains in this movie are all very three dimensional and the level of foreshadowing that comes alongside that is simply astounding     all in all a film definitely worth a watch and then another to catch all of the details you might have missed the first time thanks to that pesky yet effective foreshadowing
best animated movie of all time and my new favourite movie of all time

it has been a long time since a new aesthetically pleasing villain was introduced in an animation film whilst the past puss in boots movies have been fantastic this latest installation throws the previous into the dust the animation style is stellar vibrant and the character art is crisp and flourishing to see with the vfx effects     in a more in depth dive into the films pacing at first the giant being set up as the villain but immediately losing to puss set up an interesting perspective of who is the villain whilst many would argue death is the main antagonist he also equally isnt in a sense that his existence sets up pusss own character development death isnt evil he is instead a major factor in a characters growth     overall the film takes you along the ride of seeing puss not only as a character grow but also face his own fears as well as establish a bond with others as well

puss in boots the last wish is a terrific fantasyadventure film spinning off from the shrek universe it follows the story of puss the charming fugitive feline who following a scary encounter with death decides to stop his adventuring as he finds out he only has one life remaining soon after his journey begins one again as he finds out the mystical magic wishing star exists with the ability to grant his one wish  the wish to reclaim his nine lives of course     this however is not an easy mission as other wellknown fairy tale characters with a twist also battle for the wish overall the epic quest is filled with hilarious hearty and fearful moments with an incredibly fleshed out storyline jampacked with emotion and meaning the film successfully explores themes of friendship courage love and ultimately the beauty that one life has to offer  it is perfectly paced with the main characters having sufficient and meaningful screen time as well as an incredible dynamic with each other and each scene having an importance and relevance the animation is phenomenal and visually striking and the action scenes are fast paced smoothly transitioned and spread out to keep the film intriguing it is a oneofakind film which has the ability to appeal to both kids and adults    i would recommend this fantastic film to people of all ages as this level of storytelling and striking animation is rare to find in todays cinema

a rarity in hollywood today  a movie that entertains  probably the best film ever made in the shrek series or at least of the puss in boots series  ostensibly a kids film this has something for everyone  my teenagers wife and i all loved it it has wild half anime visual style crazy action scenes fairy tale craziness although that shtick has dropped off since the original shrek  the humor is not wall to wall but organic and almost always lands  but more importantly it has more mature themes of coming to grips with mortality and life priorities  it is an emotional roller coaster and really well done  yeah it is a little cartoonish sure but it is a kids film

this may just be my favorite movie of all time not the best movie the prince of egypt and a beautiful day in the neighborhood are the best movies ive seen but puss in boots the last wish is a mustwatch even as someone who didnt like the first movie i think this movie soars in every aspect puss kitty and perrito are a great cast of main characters each of which feel grounded and entertaining at the same time this movie having 3 villains could have made it feel overstuffed and like it was doing too much but no one villain takes time from the others and theyre all so well written jack horner is a refreshing villain he is completely irredeemable and evil something that disney should do more with its villains if they ever decide to have an actual villain again goldilocks and the 3 bears are incredibly sympathetic well written characters theyre some of my favorites wolf was so threatening generating chills any time he was onscreen the animation of this movie is so stylized and gorgeous and puts what the first puss in boots did to shame the music is great fearless hero is one of my favorite songs from a movie theres a reason everyone remembers this song after seeing this movie i could go on and on but you get the point puss in boots the last wish is an uncontested masterpiece by far my favorite dreamworks movie

spoiler warning tldr at the bottom    this is what animated kids movies should be like behind all of the bright colours of the gorgeous animation making all of the action scenes an absolute spectacle to feast your eyes onto is a simple plot with an absolutely massive impact     the story is light hearted enough so kids can get enjoyment out of it but it also treats its audience with maturity not playing safe and having the bravery to insert extremely deep messages one of which is the overarching theme of mortality and how we need to appreciate what we have    this theme is represented beautifully through its characters the protagonist puss in boots learns how he has taken his lives for granted he learns this through the other characters such as perrito     at first glance he seems like the cliché annoying side character for comic relief but turns out being a warm friendly and extremely likeable little chap the fact that he does not have a wish along with some other character traits shows us and puss how he is content with the life he has and only looks forward to his simple dreams letting the rest develop along the way his dream is to become a therapy dog which is an important detail to note further into the film     of course i cannot review this movie without mentioning death one of the best animated villains i have seen in a while he shows puss his hatred towards him for taking his lives for granted and enjoys inflicting fear into other people in his introduction scene he is extremely close to taking puss final life coming as close to a scar on his forehead with one drop of blood slowly creeping down to his shocked face another example of this films maturity in this scene we see puss experience true fear for the first time in his life as he is petrified of dying right there right then this is the moment he comes to realise how much he has taken for granted and it was all at the fault of this menacing wolf character    but it doesnt stop there he constantly torments puss showing up throughout random parts of the film in which every appearance send massive chills down puss and my spine with his truly uncanny whistle     one of these appearances leads to what is in my opinion one of the most powerful scenes in the film puss begins to run away in a state of absolute to panic before coming to a stop we see that he is struggling to breathe and his vision is blurry perrito is the only one there and without any dialogue perrito simply rests his head on puss chest and in a slow decent into calmness puss regains his control perrito has completed his dream of being a therapy dog the shear realism of this scene along with the mature dealing of the situation is what makes this scene and this film in general truly one of a kind     to finalise we also have many other great characters most notably goldi the three bears the redeemable villains who learn to appreciate their family and big jack horner the pure evil villain who does not appreciate what he has at all to which he learns to consequences overall he is an extremely funny character with a charming evil to him all of these characters are balanced out perfectly through the films perfect pacing nothing seems to drag on at all    tldr  this movie is an incredible creation all the characters are amazing in their respected ways the animation is a true spectacle of passion and creativity and the plot is simple but truly impactful with the balance of light hearted humour and the downright mature themes     personal experience  i have never felt so much towards a film before the mature themes especially hit hard and really made me look over how i spend my one life i would honestly not recommend this film to really young audiences because this film is best experienced when you truly understand the mature tones and messages i absolutely adored this film and i hope you did as well    ps this is my first proper review of a film so sorry if some parts are a bit confusing and the pacing on this is no where near as good as the films lol theres so much to say but i dont want this to be too long but still if you made it this far even if skipping to the tldr thanks for reading hope i expressed my opinions well enough

this movie is one of the best animated movies this decade and it deserves the praise its gotten this movie is so dark and mature my favorite scene was when puss is running from death and when perrito found him snd he calms him down death is horrifying and probably one of the best villains ive ever seen  jack horner is hysterical the animation is amazing and goldilocks and the three bears were a funny and an emotional group with great character arcs perrito is a great character with funny jokes and a kind and adorable personality and his sad backstor   ive watched this movie 3 times and on my second viewing ive noticed that one of the locations in the map when perrito holds it is called the river of relaxation which is where his owners nearly drowned him trust anxiety fear and emotion is handled so well and theres a lot of things for adults to enjoy death is an extremely dark villain and there is some bleeped swearing but that makes this movie the best this movie took risks and after being stuck in hell for years hollywood doesnt respect animation they think of it as something that is only meant for kids but movies like this and many other dreamworks movies like shrek how to train your dragon kung fu panda and wallace and gromit the curse of the were rabbit and to anyone who doesnt like this masterpiece than maybe these kids movies are a little to mature for you

puss in boots the last wish is a delightful cinematic experience that not only brings joy to its human audiences but also has the magical ability to charm our fourlegged friends as magnificently demonstrated by magnolia the adorable dog who gives it a resounding paw of approval    this latest installment in the puss in boots franchise once again proves that this swashbuckling feline hero is as timeless as fairy tales themselves the film combines action humor heart and of course those iconic kitten eyes to create a story that appeals to viewers of all ages    antonio banderas who has lent his voice to the character of puss in boots throughout the series continues to shine in the role his charismatic performance brings a blend of sophistication and endearing goofiness that makes puss an absolute joy to watch the characters depth and growth are beautifully portrayed in this film adding a layer of emotional resonance that is truly heartwarming    what sets the last wish apart is its ability to capture the essence of classic fairy tales while adding a modern twist the story is cleverly woven with themes of friendship selfdiscovery and the enduring bond between humans and their pets which might explain why magnolia the dog seems to adore it as much as her human companion    the animation is topnotch with lush visuals that transport you to a fantastical world filled with daring sword fights mystical creatures and breathtaking landscapes the attention to detail in the character designs and settings is a testament to the dedication of the animation team    the humor in the film is both witty and slapstick appealing to a wide range of humor preferences whether its a clever oneliner that makes you chuckle or a comical chase scene that has you in stitches the last wish keeps the laughs coming throughout its runtime    and lets not forget the soundtrack which complements the film beautifully the music adds depth to the emotional moments and excitement to the action sequences enhancing the overall viewing experience    in a world where we often long for stories that make us smile and remind us of the magic of storytelling puss in boots the last wish is a heartwarming gem its a film that manages to captivate not only its human audience but also the furry friends who share our homes making it a true familyfriendly adventure    so whether youre a devoted fan of the puss in boots franchise or just looking for a feelgood movie to enjoy with your loved ones including the fourlegged members of your family puss in boots the last wish is a mustsee that will leave you with a warm heart and a big smile

a very funny colorful and well animated movie puss in boots the last wish goes surprisingly deep into its main character giving a multilayered personality and a very satisfying character development the whole cast is particularly efficient to hook you up in their adventure protagonists and antagonists all shine in their way and give you new favorites in the shrek universe   things go fast here since the main goal is to entertain puss in boots dont take too much time in event that would usually ask for a little more development its notable but not necessarily a bad thing since the characters really help to smooth things with how they command the pacing  the last wish is unexpectedly violent with literal deaths in it a few drops of bloods and one of the character is scary not a bad point actually i found it pretty great that they dared to push a little the boundaries of family entertainment
with a great script and a beautiful final message puss in boots is one of the best animations in the studio and a great movie to watch as a family

this is a beautiful movie it worked for and completely earns all of the praise it gets     it was visually fantastic it was emotionally moving they did a wonderful job telling the story even the parts i initially thought would be annoying were great it was perfectly balanced and had such good messages throughout     this movie reminds you to appreciate life and what you have to live in the moment to make the most of the time you have to not let fear control you but that it is ok to be afraid sometimes you just need to work to overcome it it supports strong family connections whether that family is biological or not the antagonistsvillains are superb  its really funny but still gives the emotional moments time to breath and this is from a sequel movie to a spinoff about a swashbuckling cat     so many movies are the equivalent of junk food and we just keep accepting it and getting more of the same    movies like this need to be praised and supported its the only way to send a message that we are tired of the constant junk thrown at us    enormous thanks to everyone involved with the creation of this gem

we brought our almost 9yr old son and his best friend and we all loved the movie  our son was laughing so much during the movie as well as mom and dad  the visual graphics in the movie were top notch and the way they tied in childhood stories and characters into the movie plot was so cool  it was a little scary for younger kids 25yr olds as we heard some kids crying in the theater when the death character was coming to get puss  boots for his last life  over all it was one of the best kids movies and our son ranked it in his top 3 of all time  my wife ranked it as one of her favoritesmaybe her best of all time  i would agree and put it in my top three as well  because of the awesome graphics it is a movie that will be best seen in a large theater

beg for mercy from puss in boots    the concept for this film is simple puss has run out of his nine lives and can only get them back with the means of a wishing star which is in pretty high demand among the bad guys of the shrek cinematic universe the competition is goldilocks and the three bears and little jack horner who is not so little anymore along with a certain someone who is behind puss for a very specific reason    the execution of this concept is what makes this film such a treat the screenplay is straightforward and fastpaced drags somewhat in the second act but manages itself by the end the music is perfect for the aesthetic chefs kiss to be more accurate the voice acting is muy buena very good antonio banderas salma hayek florence pugh harvey guillén john mulaney wagner moura theyre all just fantastic i was genuinely invested in the characters and not solely on nostalgia not that this film does a few callbacks but those arent some cheap fanservices but something that add a little substance to the greater story    now the animation and the cinematography ughhhh its so freaking beautiful  spiderverse swung in style so puss in boots could land perfecttly on its feet there is clearly inspiration for the animation here but instead of some cheap ripoff it really feels like an artistic choice and comes off as an artists fairytale come to life here the movie literally starts with the words this is a fairytale and lives up to it the cinematography too is something to look out for this film haz better shots than i can spot in a big budget hollywood blockbuster these days dreamworks atleast never fails in that department and always manages to exceed expectations    to be honest i wasnt really expecting anything from this film because the shrek cinematic universe has been neardead for so long but this film gives me hope this film gives me something to put my faith in youd think that years of development hell would usually mean bad for a film but not for puss in boots    just go and have a good time with this and if you havent yet seen the trailer for the film dont do it just go into the film blindly like i did it will surely give you a few surprises in my opinion this is the best film in the shrek cinematic universe since shrek 2 which isnt saying a lot but it should since shrek forever after was the only good film after shrek 2    ps the new dreamworks intro is so good i just love it

puss in boots the last wish is a truly amazing movie by far the scariest villain ive seen in a while when he come on screen and the whistling just gave me chills it was perfect its was like i were being hunted by the one and only death like i can feel the fear he carries great project for a kids movie it add a lot of story to puss like the way he revealed his true colors at the end of the movie and the friendships he have along with the adventures he have showing that puss is a huge character in the shrek universe even one of the strongest he last against death in a battle i really like how they end the movie spoilers they way death gave him a chance at life because he showed who he really is and hes not that overconfident guy who think he can work alone he shows that he have heart death was no longer searching for that same guy anymore he saw his true self i love that instead of just making it where they made death surrender or die or show that hes weak the moral of the story and the text make a lot of sense and was inspiring truly an experience    the villain in this movie is really scary and the whistling sound that he make gave me chills i could feel the fear that he carry like i was being hunted by death himself this movie is a great project for kids because it add a lot of story to puss in boots character we see him reveal his true colors at the end of the movie and the friendships he have along with the adventures he go on this show that puss is a huge character in the shrek universe and even one of the strongest because he last against death in a battle    i really like how the movie end spoilers death gave puss a chance at life because he showed who he really is and hes not just an overconfident guy who think he can work alone he show that he have heart death was no longer searching for that same guy anymore because he saw pusss true self i love that the movie didnt just make death surrender or die or show that hes weak the moral of the story and the text make a lot of sense and was truly inspiring the movie is a great reminder that its important to show our true selves and that we can all change for the better    in conclusion puss in boots the last wish is a great movie that you should definitely watch the story is engaging the characters are interesting and the villain is truly scary the movie add a lot of depth to puss in boots character showing that hes a strong and complex character in the shrek universe the movies ending is satisfying and inspiring reminding us of the importance of being true to ourselves if youre a fan of shrek or just looking for a great family movie puss in boots the last wish is definitely worth a watch

time to wake up disney dreamworks has long been eating your lunch and puss just finished your dessert i cannot praise this movie enough its a visual feast hilarious in places and sombre and honest where it counts and they let the hardhitting moments linger none of this wisecracking a joke right away that the mcu does just in case the audience stops laughing for 3 seconds    the last wish is a breath of fresh air it doesnt harp on at the audience it doesnt lecture and it doesnt reiterate the typical environment good white men bad rhetoric that disney has been repeating since they turned awful puss carries a genuinely essential and universal message about making the most of your life overcoming hardships and bad luck and coming out all the stronger for it with an appreciation for what you have it may be hard for modern audiences to relate to putting others needs before your own instant selfish gratification but its nice that thats also a theme    its fantastic and i would love to see more studios returning to a more wholesome and honest approach to making movies enough woke bs

i watched the movie for the first time a little under two months ago and can i just say i was in awe i was in florida visiting my grandparents for vacation and it was one of the first things i wanted to do with my grandma while there i had heard a lot of praise for the movie from my friends age range 1420 and since im an enjoyer of animation in the first place i went to go see it now i will say i went into this with little background of how the first movie went  i had watched it once and that was several years prior good thing about the last wish though  you dont need too much background information so to an extent it can work as a standalone movie if you really want it to be going into the actual movie wow the animation was absolutely stunning they definitely took a lot of inspiration from into the spiderverse regarding the animation mixing the 2d and 3d together ive seen several reviews saying that made it hard to watch or look cheap but it was quite the opposite quite dynamic it was also very colorful and very detailed but not too much so  just right as goldilocks would say speaking of goldilocks regarding the characters i think they were also very well done its easy to root for puss hes not one of those protagonists that you get bored and annoyed with especially with kitty and perrito supporting him in his leading role the villains of the movie were also very well done death the wolf was quite ominous and accurately embodied death straight up goldilocks was a flawed character rather than an actual evil one and it was nice that her story and wish was resolved at the end in a sweet way though i will say if i have any critiques at all you could see that from a mile away jack horner though being the most unapologetically evil character is also one of the funniest and most memorable of all killer design funny lines john mulaney did such a great job voicing him in fact all of the voice actors and actresses were flawless  they fit their characters and fit the tones perfectly   a lot of reviews against this movie say its too dark but i think thats what makes this movie so beautiful yes one of the main topics is mortality and if thats not something you are ready to talk about with your child  assuming thats who youre going to bring to the movie  then do not bring them however if you want them to be able to discuss and see the topic of mortality in a healthy safe way this is definitely the movie for you a lot of media these days struggles in how to discuss death i think the last wish definitely illustrates how ominous and scary the topic of death may be with its personification of death the wolf character at the same time puss is able to tackle his fear of death in the end   all things considered this movie absolutely knocked it out of the park there is so much to enjoy out of this movie from humor fun characters sweet moments dynamic fight scenes which do not take up the whole movie by the way absolutely gorgeous animation and a killer soundtrack that doesnt get enough creditand of course the fact that there is a lot to think about after watching it   i highly recommend this movie treat yourself andor your loved ones and go watch it

this is the first time where i have seen the audience scores aligned with the critic scores normally i would say critic scores are trying to be cooperatefriendly and be as nice as possible to the moviethe exact opposite of what a critic is ironically but i have to say the critic and audience score is very justified i may or may not update this post because i have only seen this movie once    so right now i am going to be upfront and write my critiques out of the way so i can talk about the good stuff after    so i dont know if its the effects of my sensory issues and loud movie theater speakers clashing but it induced a bit of anxiety in me it couldve just be the first few minutes kind of rushing through along with other effects or it was just loud speakers and my sensitive ears colliding i really dont know i would have to rewatch so other time to see the first few minutes are kind of just a fuzzy memory to me    i also dont know why they didnt just address the problem between puss and softpaws earlier in the movie there isnt necessarily anything bad about it but i feel it wouldve been better addressed earlier    thats really my only concerns not even a problem really    i think that all the villians are all pretty solid for there being multiple villains you know what scratch that they arent just solid villains they are all really good villains plain an simple     jack horner isnt trying to be relatable at all he doesnt have some sad back story that tries to get you to sympathize with him he is just pure evil he believes only he should be entitled to his power doesnt give a damn about anyone else and would do anything to get what he want even if it means needlessly putting others lives at risk even those who dedicate there services to him it is a bit more refreshing to see that we arent being guilt tripped through a story and we are being shown that evil isnt made because of bad things it can just be made in anyone regardless plain and simple     he also isnt 2 dimensional either he might not have a conscious telling him what right and wrong is but you are shown he has a reason for doing it even if you dont understand his ideologies or reasonings it is showcased in ways that you understand what he is doing and why he knows that once he gets his hands on the power no one will be able to stop him anyway and he is confident he can get it    ohhh and death death is just amazing to watch on screen he literally gave me the chills anytime he was on screen and i love it thats how you right a villain when his presence on screen is so intense that you get chills just seeing him he is just a badass through and through nothing else and i dont mean it metaphorically or rhetorically or poetically or theoretically or any other fancy way he is a total badass straight up    he has so many memorable quotes i just cant help but reference them as i am writing this review he is genuinely that fun and memorable as a villain     he also has a motive that isnt just clear like jack horners but you understand why and you dont just understand why his motives are almost justified you almost root for him at times    not to mention puss in boots arc where he goes from arrogant ass who doesnt truly value his lives until he realizes he doesnt have any to lose to one who would like to spend his life wisely and happily realizing what life is    everyone going after the wish has a reason to go after the wish and then they realize they had what they wished for and its just so good it shows that you could learn to look at what you have and not take it for granted    i could go on for hours and hours why this movie was such a good movie but i bet you probably came here for a shorter review just to see if this movie you didnt come for a whole essay so i am going to cut it short here and save everyone including myself time this movie is going to be one of the highest ratings i may ever give to a movie its that good watch it as soon as possible

puss in boots the last wish is a thrilling adventure that will have you on the edge of your seat  and its not just because of the swashbuckling hero himself dreamworks has outdone themselves with this latest installment in the franchise and one of the highlights is the mindblowing performance by death wolf    this new character voiced by the talented idris elba is a force to be reckoned with his menacing presence and cunning tactics make him a worthy adversary for puss in boots and his new allies and when death wolf finally unleashes his full power the results are truly aweinspiring    but death wolf is just one of many memorable characters in this movie puss in boots voiced once again by the incomparable antonio banderas is as swashbuckling and charming as ever and the addition of new allies like dulcinea voiced by the delightful tiffany haddish adds depth and heart to the story    ง    of course it wouldnt be a dreamworks movie without stunning animation and plenty of humor puss in boots the last wish delivers on both counts with breathtaking visuals and plenty of laughs to keep audiences of all ages entertained    in a world where animated movies are a dime a dozen puss in boots the last wish stands out as a true gem with its unforgettable characters thrilling story and mind blowing performance by idris elba its a mustsee for anyone who loves great movies

puss in boots the last wish is an absolute delight from start to finish bringing back the swashbuckling feline hero we all know and love in a brand new adventure that will leave audiences purring with delight with stunning animation hilarious humor and heartwarming moments that will tug at your heartstrings dreamworks has once again proven that they are the masters of familyfriendly entertainment    while disney may have a storied history of creating classic animated films puss in boots the last wish shows that dreamworks is truly a force to be reckoned with from the intricate character designs to the intricate fight scenes every aspect of this film has been expertly crafted with care and attention to detail    if youre looking for a movie that will transport you to a magical world filled with adventure romance and plenty of laughs then look no further than puss in boots the last wish dreamworks has truly outdone themselves with this latest installment in the beloved franchise and its a mustsee for anyone who loves great animation and storytelling

one of dreamworks best movies and honestly one of my favorite animated films of all time the last wish is just amazing all around and im really happy now that more stylized animation is being used by other studios in a really cool way this movie was one of the last movies that i thought was going to be really good but im very happy that it went above and beyond what i thought it was going to be the story is pretty cliche and generic yes but its everything around the story that makes this film so good the animation is incredibly the spiderverse style works very well for this film and it still stands out from spiderverse in its own unique way the characters and their own respective arcs are great there really isnt one weak character here puss himself gets some excellent development and his journey of grabbing with the concept of death is very emotional and well written kitty softpaws also has a really good arc and chemistry with puss and perrito has some really great moments all of the villains here are great goldilocks and the 3 bears all have a good arc and jack horner is one of the funniest characters ever included in an animated film and works amazingly well as the irredeemable villain but the real standout here is death death is probably one of if not the best dreamworks villain to have death be personified and built up the way it is in the film is just something else his interactions with puss were always amazing the humor was great as well pretty much every joke from jack landed and all the other jokes were really great as well everyone involved with this film felt like they really cared about the characters and the story and thats what makes the film so great i would highly recommend checking this film out as its genuinely one of the best films of 2022 and one of the best animated movies ever

puss in boots the last wish absolutely took my breath away this work of art provides everything you could ask for in an animated film the animation was superb with a slight action style that added a unique spark to the already beautiful visuals which had such a variety of themes plus the character design im still getting over how amazing the wolf looked absolutely horrifying but so fun to watch the direction was one of the best ive seen in any animated movie with stunning shots that im shocked other films havent used the worldbuilding was so compelling with elements of fantasy and adventure so interesting and thoughtprovoking and ideas so brilliant ive truly never seen anything like it the voice acting was perfect casting celebrities that are actually good at voice acting and actors ive never seen before that still were great the characters were set up so well with emotional sequences and character building that was heartfelt and realistic despite the movie being about talking animals and fictional creatures the comedy was wonderful with disney parodies and fairy tale references plus sequences that were extremely funny theres practically nothing wrong with this movie everything was so riveting and fun to watch always entertaining you while keeping you in suspense overall this is one of the best movies ive ever seen animated or not i was invested throughout the entire experience rooting for characters in their toughest moments and genuinely tearing up multiple times this movie is outstanding

my first cinema experience of 2023 and what a good one it was i didnt have high expectations  i decided on a whim to see it after two recommendations in separate unrelated youtube videos i didnt even remember this is a sequel nevertheless it was fantastic and a fantastic standalone film the animation style is delightful and similar in many ways to into the spiderverse with an overall painterly comic book aesthetic and creative use of variable frame rate and colour the story brilliantly balances real heart with cracking jokes the characters are all super endearing and energetically acted  suave puss and his old flame kitty effervescent perrito relentlessly comedically cruel jack horner surprisingly familial goldi and her three bears and the spectre following puss everywhere the story is interesting taking someone who has grown to think himself untouchable and challenging him to stop thinking about himself for once and along the way a loner learns to trust again a dog with the saddest backstory finds a loving family and an adopted child comes to appreciate her found family so much else to love  the shrek cameos the touching portrayal of a panic attack the inuniverse theme song he is your favourite fearless hero the touches of anime in fight choreography i cant wait to see it again

puss in boots the last wish is a masterpiece the movie was over 10 years in the making and it shows not a single part of it feels rushed forced or poorly done it has gotten stellar reviews on all fronts because the movie is flawless in every regard its no wonder that a fantastically executed depiction of one of the most consistently beloved characters in history makes for the greatest movie of all time  the movie utilizes an animation style inspired by spiderman into the spiderverse a movie similarly praised by critics nigh on universally for its fantastic art dreamworks used this same system in the production of puss in boots another example of why the decadelong wait after its original announcement contributed to how truly spectacular the movie is the paintinglike style of art created an atmosphere that felt very much like a fairytale as opposed to the justoffreality vibe that cgi movies of the past had or the totally devoid of realism style of completely handdrawn movies such as aladdin or the lion king dreamworks gave us the best that there is in the animated world by refusing to hold back on the art style the fact that all movies with higher acclaim amongst critics happen to be live action only serves to illustrate why this movie isnt considered better by so called professionals  this artstyle helps contribute to the simply stunning fight scenes in puss in boots the last wish however the visuals are not the only thing that makes the swordsmanship in this movie stand out unlike other movies using swords the last wish holds a great degree of accuracy to real life swordsmanship in every single fight it is clear who is attacking who who is on offense who is on defense puss can be seen parrying and then counter attacking with a well executed riposte just like in real fencing puss fight with death at the end of the movie is the most spectacular fight throughout with both characters showing off the true height of their ability utilizing their respective advantages in speed dexterity strength size cunning and more and not just pointlessly slapping sticks together between them whats more puss use of a socalled gatito blade in his offhand is highly consistent with the use of parrying daggers which were quite popular in italy and spain for use in rapier fencing such historical accuracy is quite rare in tv shows and movies and for it to be found in a childrens movie where that is rarely a concern just goes to show how much effort was put into the movie finer details such as these serve to show just how great of flawless masterpiece this movie really is whats more every fight in the movie serves a purpose other than just violence for the sake of violence they help create exposition advance the plot and develop characters whether that be by showing big jack horners ruthlessness the strengthening of three bears familial bonds or galvanizing puss to be brave and value his lives and the time he has with his friends  the message of the story is found in the final fight scene without having to be explicitly said the message is still clear you should cherish every second the movie also has much to say about how its ok to be afraid a lesson many young boys and all men really need to hear it has a flawless and nuanced depiction of a panic attack something that cant be said for most movies and shows us that we dont always have as much control as we thought we did and thats ok therein lies the elegance of puss in boots the last wish it is at its heart a childrens movie and therefore has the obligation to leave the audience with a clear and positive message this is no easy task for a movie to accomplish without being heavy handed luckily for the last wish the movie is far from heavy handed with every message in the story being flawlessly woven into the very essence of the movie instead of being carelessly stapled on top like so many other movies do the reward of being appropriate for all audiences and for leaving them all with a positive message is incalculable and one of the many reasons puss in boots the last wish is greater than any other movie despite their higher approval amongst critics  puss in boots the last wish is a work of art it is not only accessible to all audiences but entertaining to them as well it surrounds a beloved character that is a knownquantity in his beloved status amongst all and does him justice in innumerable ways the movies attention to detail and sheer visual beauty set it apart from any other animated movie ever made while its character development positive messages and ability to stay within a pg rating puts it far ahead the dark live action movies that dominate the highest rated spots amongst movie review websites dreamworks didnt hold back on this one and on god it shows

just as everyone expected a sequel to a spinoff to the shrek franchise that took 11 years to arrive in theatres was the animated movie that took the world by storm     the last wish really did defy expectations assuming people had any the animation style was refreshing for the franchise the humor was more balanced with the characterdriven story and despite maintaining three different villains the film feels solid rather than clunky instead of frequent pop culture references and dodgy jokes that pad for time in the later shrek films this puss in boots sequel weaves the influences of classic spaghetti westerns and swashbuckler films with a family adventure storyline and affirmative positive themes about appreciating life and those around you it knows when to be lighthearted and when to be serious and introduces us to one of the coolest original villains in family animation  a wolf embodiment of death  by not holding back on the menacing aura and instead focusing on it hopefully the sense of danger will encourage other franchises to stop oversanitizing their films if i were in the movies target audience it would probably be a film i would swear by for the rest of my life sort of like shrek 2 but in this case ill just call it a very good family movie that came out of nowhere    i hope youre all ready for more shrek because now its basically guaranteed to happen and they will likely be disappointing 355

as a cartoon movie lover i have watched the movie called puss in boots the last wish i have watched the last puss in boots movie in 2011 it seems like it brings back our childhood memories due to the technology the animation is better than the last movie 10 years ago puss in boots is a cat with boots a brave hero with nine lives the movie starts with a fighting scene and he lost the eighth life in the opening battle and he only has one life he started to be afraid to die and he wanted to find the wishing star that can give him back his nine lives    on his journey finding the last wishing star there are a lot of adventures awaiting and he meet unexpected characters the one is his lover and the other is a dog he named him pero or perito which means dog in spanish his life story shocks to the audience but he has positive thinking about everything he faced in his life apart from puss in boots there are villains who are trying to find the wishing star there is also a villain is the big bad wolf named death who is trying to take puss in boots39s life instead of trying to find the wishing star if you watch the whole movie you will know death is not a villain the fighting scene between death and puss in boots is epic every time death appears it makes my bone chill his style and background music are so artistic    it is interesting that who got the wishing star and you will find out because it is unexpected plot twist overall this movie is really good and more than a just fun cartoon movie that a family gather and watch the animation style and the story line of the movie are great and i want to say puss in boots is coming back with great success

puss in boots the last wish made me sign up to this platform to give a review thats how good it was     the films animation and art style is amazing blending stylized 3d visuals with beautiful 2d animation and effects to create a visually appealing movie on the lines of spiderman into the spiderverse    then we get the story a story that deals with the themes of life and death so maturely that you forget this is supposed to be a familyfriendly childrens movie and thats because its a movie for everyone whos protagonist just happens to be your favourite fearless hero puss in boots   i havent seen a film deal with this theme so maturely in so long the acceptance of ones own mortality being a reason to find things worth fighting for in your one life   pib might be the best interpretation and dealing with said theme i have ever seen     and at the heart of it all is a film that doesnt take your time for granted being around 100 minutes long short for this current age of cinema keeps the pace going whilst allowing for those slow moments to make you feel puss every thought and feeling on his latest adventure     and plenty of fun and entertainment to be had     no matter how old you are you need to go see this movie

i dont usually review movies but feel the urge to after seeing puss in boots the last wish its been a long time since i came out of the cinema feeling pure joy for a film i am one of those people who loved shrek 1 and 2 deciding not to watch the sequels and spin offs after so when i heard about this puss in boots movie i wasnt jumping to see it my partner saw the trailer and was eager for me to watch too once id seen the trailer i knew there was something special and different happening with dreamworks this time    obviously the visuals were the no1 thing that drew me to the film i loved the inspiration they took from into the spiderverse i also see a bit of arcane and wes andersons fantastic mr fox the fight scenes are epic like attack on titan    the characters are hilarious and i loved the themes that played throughout if youve ever experienced anxiety or depression and have started therapy this movie will probably stir up your emotions hopefully in a good way i absolutely recommend everyone see this movie if dreamworks keeps this creative team id be excited to see what theyll make next this is the kind of creation that disney is falling behind on

completing the return to form for dreamworks animation that began with abominable and continued with the croods 2 and the bad guys puss in boots the last wish just might be one of the studios best films since how to train your dragon 2 with gorgeous spiderverseinspired animation exhilarating action sequences  though not quite as jawdropping as the sea beast  a chilling villain welldefined characters some cameos that felt like reuniting with old friends and some really good lessons about coming to terms with your own mortality as well as a beautiful new logo for the studio thats arguably better than the shortlived one from httyd 3 puss in boots 2 just might be one of the best animated films of 2022 a visually stunning darkly humourous fantasy adventure thats possibly one of the best installments in the shrek franchise since shrek 2

it exceeded my expectations in terms of plot it was much more nuanced than the previous movie all of the characters were once again lovable and with distinct personalities in some ways there were many cliche and memey moments but even so it didnt bother me at all and simply added to the movies charm though those moments were cliche they all served a purpose in sharing a slightly deeper meaning when thought about in a more serious manner however the animation style wasnt better in my opinion i know many people enjoyed the more cartoony style in this movie but i think i prefer the older one this one had frame rates that were slightly too low for me and sometimes the action felt like the theater was experience screen lag i also appreciated the detail in the first one more slight spoiler the last wish tackled themes of death and the fear of it as well as found family appreciation pride and more i was thoroughly impressed at how the producers executed these themes in a way that is entertaining and for kids while being very honest about them

this movie is a lot better than it needed to be when studios seem to just pump out uninteresting sequels and spinoffs to grab the cash of poor parents who begrudgingly bring their kids to watch annoying talking animals and bright colors     no this film goes hard from the fresh animation style to the well written and acted script to the dazzling action scenes you can really tell the animators and everyone actually put heart and effort into making something pretty amazing     its one of those wow where did this come from moments that makes you forget this isnt pixar  this is a sequel to a spinoff of a 4 film franchise of which it breathes new life into     along with sonys spiderman into the spiderverse and the mitchells vs the machines this dreamworks film should be a wakeup call to disney and pixar who are now at serious risk of falling behind with their tired animation and direction     the oscar nomination for best animated feature is well deserved

i went to the theaters with high expectations considering all the good reviews and believe it or notthey were exceeded immensely im shocked at how spectacular this film was its nearly tied with shrek 2 as my favorite shrek related film its not quite as good but it came pretty close that alone should tell you how good it is the animation has a spiderverse like feeland the action scenes were spectacular now lets get to what everyone is talking about the villain the literal personification of death death is honestly such a scary villian for a kids movie i was shocked at how intense and suspenseful his scenes were everytime you heard his whistle you new stuff was about to go down i liked jack horner as a surprise villian hes existentense was kinda spoiled by social media but i wont spoil anything here goldie locks and the three bears were a fun addition im shocked the film didnt feel overstuffed puss in boots was very good having to face his mortality and some heavy subject matters kitty softpaws also had a good arc about trustand the world trust wasnt said a million times like a certain disney movie perito was a funny addition that never got annoying i love how optimistic he was considering his backstory this movies story was dark about puss being down to his last life and looking for the last wish and death hunting him down this is a must see for all ages 1010 one of the best dreamworks and shrek related films

thought it will be one of those generic kids movies to my surprise it had very touching scenes like when perrito calmed down puss when he had a panic attack which is something you dont see in kids movies or at the end when puss realizes that he doesnt need to wish for his 9 lives to be restored and that he should cherish his last life also goldilocks and the three bears crime family thing was weird in a good way they had some very heart warming moments like when goldilocks said that she wants a real family and not the bears the bears were sad to hear her wish but they agreed to help her later on goldi saves kid bear while saying that the family she has is just right big jack horner not a lot to say casual rich power hungry character just that he is a maniac he doesnt care for his crew or anyone really besides himself and to my surprise he isnt annoying just a grown up child sad backstory though death there isnt really anything i can say about him that wasnt said before he is the perfect villain he terrifies puss the legend who was never touched by a blade fear for for his life puss ran away to mama lunas cat house some time story happens puss meats death while seeing his previous lives as they mock him for being a coward and not the legendary puss in boots and he keeps convincing himself that the wish will make him the legend once again and then death arrives remembering their previous encounter puss starts to run he also saw death when he kitty softpaws and the bear family jack horner fought for the map he heard deaths and took off puss fights death one last time but this time he appreciates his last life then death leaves and he says to puss you know well meet again right i know lobo lobo death  so yeah good movie perhaps i jumped places hear but good movie pusss relationship with kitty is very good perrito is amazing he is so positive that he doesnt realize that his tragic past is tragic good jokes very good fighting scenes similar to spider i went to see this movie this past sunday i went into this movie off the hype i was hearing about from other people so my expectations were high for the movie which can often only end in disappointment when a movie doesnt live up the the idea of it within your own mind     im glad to say the movie not only met my expectations but sailed way above them    the voice acting sound effects animation story and camera angles in every scene were phenomenal from the most gripping fight scenes to the most heartwarming scenes to compare i recently also went to see the sequel to avatar as well and if i was asked to make a choice between the two it would but puss in boots without hesitation     the characters and story had development and character arcs that i didnt expect to have in a puss in boots movie however that only made the movie the more refreshing and gripping youve got heroes and villains that are incredibly relatable as well as the comically villainous villains which all culminates an incredible finale for the characters and viewer     if youve the choice between this and any other movie out right now pick puss in boots

puss in boots the last wish is the perfect animated film  you might think im exaggerating because its an animated dreamworks  film about a talking cat in shoes from the shrek universe going on a typical adventure but thats because you arent looking deeply enough into the film about a talking cat form the shrek universe puss in boots is at its core a story about the idea of laughing in the face of death and coming to terms with our undeniable mortality and a story of living your one or nine lives the best you can its a story that juggles anxiety and panic attacks paired with the feeling that death is looming around you constantly waiting to strike and its a film about what fear does to you and what it does to your relationship and your life    puss and boots starts with puss going on a normal adventure  throwing a party and then killing a giant but then he dies which he seems completely unfazed by until he realizes hes on his last life and is prescribed retirement     ive never been a fan of the dreamworks art style its just never stood out to me but with puss in boots  the last wish  i genuinely enjoyed the way they animated it their use of the more 2d art style in a mostly 3d animated film was gorgeous and definitely did more than offer a nod to spiderman into the spiderverse it genuinely excites me that one of my favorite animated films spiderman into the spider verse could be having such an effect on animation and the industry the animation in spiderman into the spiderverse genuinely made me so happy and i thought the scenes were absolutely gorgeous ive been animating for multiple years now and ive won competitions for my animation and i love animation analysis and both of these movies really stand out to me    not only is this movie gorgeous but its also smart this movieas i said tackles bigger topics and enthralled you with its gorgeous animation but it also appeals to the right audiences because of course its a kids film so kids are going to watch it but whos taking them to the movies adults how do you appeal to adults thats a question the animation industry has been looking at for years theyve tried things such as more adult jokes which the shrek universe is famous for but in the end they just feel like cheap laughs i took my dad and my sister to see puss in boots the first time i watched it and my dad genuinely laughed at parts he found lots of teh humor amusing such as the jiminy cricket sketch and the goldilocks dynamic this movie appeals to lots of people and does it well and they have the numbers to prove it

this movie is a masterpiece everything about it is perfect  the story the characters the animation the sound design even the pacing its an absolute pleasure to watch and i recommend it to everyone  the story is great despite being an animated movie deeply connected to ones made previously for children it doesnt sway from tackling more deep and challenging problems the main characters go through a lot in this movie and it is reflected by their behaviour  the sound design is immaculate certain sound cues being played at perfect times to signal danger fear or comfort it is perfect to the point of the whistling one character does becoming very iconic and every time it appears you know they are near  the animation is top notch workers at dreamworks clearly putting in a lot of effort to create the best in a long time characters move through the environment clearly interacting with it as they go making us feel like they really are there instead of just being pasted in later the animation is fluid so when an enemy moves with less frames per second you can tell they are dangerous and clunky and when later the same animation style is done to the main character while escaping you know they are the ones in danger the animators doing little tricks like the one previously mentioned shows just how skilled they are in the art  the characters are all memorable each ones personality being very defined and different from the others this leads to some conflicts but also is a nice way for them to interact without it feeling forced the new additions to the cast  the little dog the main villain and others dont feel shoe horned in instead feeling simply like extensions of the world we just havent seen before  this movie was masterfully done in all aspects and i cannot recommend it enough to everyone you should most definitely watch it or youll miss out on one of the most amazing movies ive seen in a while

i have always been a big animation fan i grew up with shrek franchise but honestly i didnt expect anyting special from the movie cause the dreamworks studio and animation having not the best years how wrong was i  after absolutelly horrible movies about boss baby dreamworks ressurected with amazing puss in boots for examplei exspected perrito to be a regular dumb comic relief and i was wrong again its a very good character who makes sense for the plot and other characters evolution the villians  base both jack horner and wolf catch the eye it was so brave to do that serious villians i respect that the animation the music the drama side characterrs locations designs jokes shrek and farytales references  i noticed that all and all authors hard work dreamorks is back on track and ready to meet disney on the animation battlefield again like back in early 2000s they have already gave a lesson how to do an amazing family movie withot trying to follow all fashionable trends
