this movie was absolutely incredible it has a very good message about the value of life and some of the best villainsantagonists i have seen the significant characters had a captivating screen presence and were all so much fun in addition to that it portrays anxiety in a realistic way when it shows puss having a panic attack the visuals were a stunning mix of 3d animation watercolor and that spiderverseey style    as far as story goes it serves its purpose of humbling puss and develops his character in a believable way while still keeping him as the same lovable feline    i admit i initially thought perrito would have been the stereotypical annoying kevin hart side character but i couldnt have been more wrong he was surprisingly lovable and endearing he even helped puss through a panic attack in the same way real therapy dogs do     jack horner was absolutely hilarious goldilocks and the three bears were surprisingly wholesome and death filled me with pantsshitting fear every time i heard his whistle    puss in boots the last wish is altogether an incredible movie 100 a must watch

this movie is the best movie ive ever seen i am disappointed with it only having 95 on the tomatometer it deserves more but 95 is still high  anyways lets get in topic  in this review we will have 7 categories to cover and rate  characters the characters are a sweet and pure 1010 their backstories are very creative with goldilocks perrito and jack horner and the characters dont make you feel like they are just added in because the studio can it makes you feel that every characters have their main purpose of being in the show every character is just a puzzle piece in this movie  casting the cast for the movie is gold 910 john mulaney fits the role for jack horner and death sounds so good every character feels like if the animation speaks without any person voicing it mouse syncing is very good too  villains 1110 no explanation here wait no 1110 its not gold its diamond  animation animation is super good like how they use a similar style with one of the best movies out there spiderman into the spiderverse but instead of making the visuality looks like a comic book they made the visuality looks like a fairy tale book it looks so bright and actually give that art made out of paint fairy tale book vibe  plot 1210 the plot is what brings together this magnificent movie so no explanation same for the villain  action 10010 this is like an anime type of combatfighting fast paced effects that is more likely to make you watch every single part of the scene and sounds in those scene are so satisfying  soundtrack 810 fearless hero is a banger my favorite out of the bunch is horner heist no context

this was a vacuous shell of a move lacking everything that that made the first one so endearing what a stinker  watching the beginning song and dance sequence that introduces the newly animated look of puss i was dismayed at the cheap looking slapstick action lacking any of the charm that oozed from all the characters in the original that had incredibly detailed expressions  it set the tone for the whole rest of the movie  all the clever humour and emotion that appealed just as much to the adult audience was gone and replaced by hannabarbera type cartoony action  maybe mildly entertaining only for kids below the age of 7  also without meaning to sound ageist banderas and hayeks voices were simply too old and croaky to be fitting for the characters unfortunately sounded more suitable for grandadgrandma type characters

considering how terrible the first puss and boots was i was beyond skeptical that this was going to be just another bad animated action movie boy was i wrong    this movie was a wonderfully crafted masterpiece dream works out did themselves by finally making the puss and boots movie many early 2000s viewers of shrek 2 have been wanting to see since the introduction of puss   the movies story was incredibly thought out and had so much genuine character something the first film lacked speaking of characters every single character was amazing going back to the twisted fairy tales we have seen all the way back with the first shrek each character was well thought out from goldie and the 3 bears to jack hawner each one was fine crafted i must personally say though that there was a definite outlier death every single time he was on the screen he stole the show from the design to backstory and his signature eyrie whistle the designers knew exactly what they were doing by making death as bad ass as he is     the story and characters all though excellent would not have been as marvelous if the animators stuck to the original shrek style instead they overhauled it and went with a much more spider verse style which perfectly complemented the story and action to a tee i love that the company understood what made the last puss in boots movie so flawed and set out to make perhaps one of what must be the pinacol of animated movies up there with the likes of how to train your dragon and toystory everyone i went to watch this with was talking about the animation and characters for hours after our first watch and i personally can not wait to watch it again as well as draw some fan art for this movie     dreamworks pride yourself on a movie made perfectly and please keep up the top work additionally if i could give you a higher score i dam well would

with 2022 bringing many mediocre movies to the table puss in boots the last wish left 2022 with a bang    from being just an off shoot from the shrek franchise this movie really lives up to the legendary name of puss in boots the 2011 film being just a meh movie of puss in boots really didnt feel remarkable in any way but the last wish this is what makes movies so great to watch     such a simple plot to follow accompanied with such rich and dynamic characters and relationships really keeps you to wanting to see more of these characters interacting and talking     not a single character felt underutilized even the characters that didnt have much screen time had their role fulfilled the story had such maturity with several difficult topics to tackle for a pg film they absolutely handled them correctly and almost perfectly humour is definitely a strength of this movie with a broad range of jokes from such different characters

illumination needs to take notes dreamworks has laid out the blueprint on how to make a good sequel this movie was fantastic and it started with the animation i love this new visual direction that the spiderverse is pushing everyone into and puss in boots the last wish capitalized the action sequences were so quick and comiclike and the colors popped beyond the look the story was quite good as well dreamworks picked a good handful of messages to deliver and they did it well i especially liked the arc with goldi and the bears but the very real and very persistent personification of death was alsofun maybe not the word but i was very interested there was a great blend of heart and humor and the voice cast was outstanding especially florence pugh and john mulaney this is certainly the best kids movie ive seen in a while and i hope the minions take full offense

puss in boots the last wish had a lot to live up to as most of my critic and casual friends have been praising the film and for the most part the film delivers    from the opening frames the unique art style fills the screen and is incredibly captivating there is some excellent combination of 3d animation with 2d styles that i have not seen before the combat frame rate shift was also a nice touch that worked better than i was expecting action was top notch with some incredible set pieces and superb choreography    the last wish deals with some pretty heavy themes for an animated childrens movie death is something that all humans will have to face which was handled in such a nuanced and mature way here from panic attacks to haunting imagery death looms large throughout the entire film and serves as a menacing villain the journey our heroes take to confront this fear is very heartwarming and will resonant with most audience members    with most dreamworks pictures the comedy is targeted at both children and adults i did find myself laughing out loud at plenty of jokes but just as many landed flat for me this would be more of an issue but this is an incredibly balanced film with great action and dramatic moments that leave little room for a few flat jokes to make a large impact on my experience    i genuinely believe that this movie has restored the shrek universe and can propel the future projects upward hype has officially been restored for shrek 5    score 86  verdict great

the only explanation i have for all the positive reviews this movie is getting is that most of them come from adults who watched it with teens or without children we went to the cinema with a group of 610 year old children trusting the 6 and above rating this movie got in germany and it was an awful experience for them    copious amounts of violence some cartoonish and played for laughs some way too intense for kids references to and portrayals of gambling  alcohol a lot of swearing  rude language sometimes censored sometimes not references to animal abuse partially played for laughs and an anthropomorphic wolf character who symbolizes death and whos significantly too terrifying for young children multiple kids in the cinema started crying had to be escorted out of the hall or had to close their eyes for large stretches of the movie at one point a character calls another character a pssy  which is a somewhat lame cat pun in the original english but in german thats lost in translation and ends up being straight up vulgarity that has no place in a movie rated 6 beyond those crassly childunfriendly elements the plot of the movie and the underlying themes living the life you got facing death  fears were neither interesting to nor understandable for our kids another issue was the fake spanish accent of the main character since we saw the movie in german i cant judge the original voicework but in the german version the main character was sometimes very difficult to understand even for the adults    this movie illustrates a larger problem age ratings have become practically meaningless and we essentially need to prescreen every single movie were considering to show to our kids to make sure its actually ageappropriate and wont cause pedagogic issues in this case trusting the german film rating board the fsk reading reviews and watching the trailer beforehand was evidently not enough and we regret taking our kids to this movie thank you fsk for deciding that a movie that makes our kids leave with the mental image of someone drowning a puppy in a river is appropriate for ages 6 and above     those issues aside from an adult perspective this movie was thoroughly meh the comicbook animation style was neat for the first few minutes but became jarring later on since it was applied very inconsistently the plot was somewhat bland and the characters didnt really stand out with the possible exception of the dog the sideplot of the bear girl and her adopted family felt tacked on and the ending felt somewhat satisfying but very telegraphed most of the jokes werent offensively bad but didnt really land either and most of the references just served to remind us of older much better movies that we could have been watching instead the quality of the voicework keep in mind im talking about the german version specifically ranged from okayish to aggressively poor    definitely not a movie were going to see again and definitely not a movie we would have shown our kids had we known what we were getting into beforehand

i will say as someone who has always been interested in the animation industry for quite some time now this has to be one of the most inspiring pieces of media to come out in recent years with all honesty i havent been so lifted from my seat and excited about a film such as this since spiderman into the spiderverse which i must thank for the seismic level shake it had on other studios for taking animation to the new level of storytelling which i believe this film provided the soundtrack as well is outstanding every single song on the album is a worthy hit which deserves to be replayed again and again dont believe me go check it out on spotify or youtube anyway as much as the film was a flavorful and visual expressive ball of energy it knew the perfect moments to slow down and take in impactful moments and allow their audience to take it all in which leads me to discuss the topic of the film mortality and by the stars they encapsulated it perfectly i was moved for i believe it is something all ages and walks of life can understand the inevitable and looming presence which death holds within all of us the anxiety which we hold until we too are at that pass which we face the inevitable nonetheless we continue and decide to make the most of the single life we are given to fight for the life we want with those we love and care for i have not seen a film tackle such a hard and difficult subject in quite some time and successfully i might add in conclusion this is an outstanding and captivating film which deserves to be talked about for years to come

im amazed how popular this film is i presume much of it has to do with how much we all love antonio banderass puss     the first film was brilliant  it truly had everything for just about every demographic and im not sure i stopped laughing from beginning to end i even enjoyed watching several episodes of the tv series that followed with my daughter who is now 8years old    this sequel was disappointing on so many levels not the least of which was editing it was too long 2 story line  a bit thin even for an animated feature 3 and this is the most important the writersdirectors didnt seem to understand the kind of film they were making while i understand the nature of the puss in boots created for the first film which i love as being a heroic and hopelessly nonselfreflective figure which makes him so wonderfully funny the sequel seemed to think it was produced by marvel studios filled as it was with overproduced action sequences that were simply boring and repetitive hence the need to cut 10 minutes     this will make a great case study in film school on how you take a sure thing and screw it up

this movie was way better than i thought it would be especially for a spin off sequel of a shrek character i really like how this movie handled the theme of grasping onto your mortality and realizing whats actually important in life and that its more than just living up to your own legend it really made puss look a look at himself and forced him to realize all that he took for granted in favor of his pride     the animation was great i love it when animation strays away from hyperrealism and gets experimental like this i wish more movies to be inspired by spiderman into the spiderverse and i want it to be a trend humans are very artistic creative we should express that more    my only gripe is that while i actually enjoyed every character in this movie i kind of wish the bear family had less screentime or not exist at all in favor of focusing more on fleshing out puss kitty or perrito i was way more invested in those three than the b plot but honestly the bear family was enjoyable enough anyway     all in all i loved the movie and while i feel some of its potential was untapped i think this is a great step forward

puss in boots the last wish was a phenomenal movie the action animation and art style are all toptier the amount of work the studio put into the animation scenes must have been incredible because i cant stress enough how fluid the animation was i did some background research and the animation team that worked on this movie also worked on spiderman into the spiderverse which makes sense you definitely see it in their quality of work the story itself was unexpectedly deep i must say that for a childrens film the themes and symbolism are all quite complex and powerful if you are an adult watching with children i strongly advise you to pay attention the morals of the stories at the end are all very heartwarming goldilocks the three bears and puss in boots are among my favorites overall a fantastic film

this movie was such a surprise for me  i usually am not a fan of animated movies as im 16 now but this completely amazed me  with some of the best character writing i have seen ever with the character death who was written with such expertise it left me in an uncontrollable state of tension and suspense when he was on and off screen  death is without a doubt my favourite villain to be brought to us definitely this year and possibly of the decade leaving me a young adult even a little uneasy at times which is the only reason that this movie is getting anything below a 4 star rating as many parents were worried thinking that death was too terrifying for a pg movie but please do not let this put you off as this movie is masterpiece  not only does it have amazing character development it also has amazing animation with dream works implementing a unique style to the movie with flashy colours    im conclusion i would without a doubt recommend this movie as a must see as i watched this movie about 2 weeks ago now and i couldnt get it out of my head how truly great this work was even motivating me to write a review for the first time in hopes that more would take up the chance to experience this masterpiece with big releases like avatar overshadowing the movie when in my opinion puss in boots is a far greater movie than avatar was

after wallowing in mediocrity for over a decade making low effort movies dreamworks reasserts itself as a leader of animation just like they did in 2001 when they popularized and made the genre of 3d animation into the powerhouse it is today    i think they learned their lesson after being outshined by other studios for so long and decided to go back to the drawing board its clear sonys into the spiderverse was a big inspiration for the movement camerawork and stylization they do their best to make the fights as dynamic as possible with long shots with a camera as well animated as the characters as they swing and jump around the scene with impressive fluidity     the movie aims for a step above the more lowbrow elements of the shrek franchise while retaining all of its defining charm and creativity making it one of the most impressive accomplishments of the dreamworks team alongside shrek 2 another incredible sequel

this sequel is far more appealing than its predecessor in every way from the beginning of the movie captivating animations combined with adventurous music attract watchers attention before watching the sequel i had low hopes for this movie but my opinions were immediately swayed at its very start this film grabbed my attention in a way much different than the first puss in boots did    in the last wish puss realizes that hes used up his 9 lives except 1 a grim reaper haunts him everywhere he goes reminding him of his possible death puss learns of a wish he can make on a star which he decides he will utilize to receive more lives he meets a chihuahua and an old friend on his way to find the star the movie covers his adventure to find the star and includes heartfelt scenes between multiple characters       overall the animations and scenery in the movie are enough to draw watchers attention the plotline of the movie is very interesting for viewers of all ages

i didnt see the original puss in boots from 2011 and im one of the seemingly very few people whos never been a fan of the shrek franchise imagine my surprise then when i sat down to watched the feisty felines latest cinematic venture the last wish and got a massive kick out of it i dont have anything against the character he just happens to be a secondary player in a film series i never liked so he was never on my radar but his newest film is from what ive heard superior to the original and certainly more well regarded than the later shrek flicks its not only got a lot of great comedy but it manages to have its share of serious moments and treats them with respect when the characters are musing on the importance of family loyalty and the perils of mortality the film isnt constantly throwing in one liners of making obnoxious gags that take you out of the moment as such the characters feel real and for lack of a better word human the quest is fun engaging because you know what each individual wants and why they want it the animation borrowing heavily from into the spiderverse uses imperfections and roughness to make things look more like classic fairy tales and when the comedy hits usually unexpectedly it gets big wellearned laughs unlike spiderverse its not a game changer but the effort thats been put into its appearance its story and its characters makes it more than worth your time

puss in boots the charming and charismatic feline from the shrek franchise is undoubtedly one of the best movie characters of all time here are 10 reasons why 1 puss in boots is a classic fairytale character with a modern twist he is a swashbuckling swordwielding hero but also has a playful mischievous side  2 he is a master of disguise and deception able to fool even the most formidable foes with his cunning and charm  3 puss in boots has a strong sense of loyalty and honor always standing by his friends and fighting for what is right  4 he is a skilled warrior able to defeat enemies with ease using his sword and acrobatic abilities 5 puss in boots is also a romantic figure always on the lookout for true love and willing to go to great lengths to protect it  6he is a role model for children showing them the importance of courage integrity and perseverance  7puss in boots is voiced by antonio banderas whose performance brings a unique energy and charisma to the character  8 his soft and fluffy appearance combined with the rough and tough attitude makes him unique and lovable  9 puss in boots is a character that resonates with audiences of all ages making him a timeless classic  10 he is an iconic character that has become a cultural phenomenon with merchandise spinoffs and a solo movie  overall puss in boots is an unforgettable and memorable character his charming personality heroic actions and his unique abilities make him one of the best movie characters of all time he is a true embodiment of what a true hero is and he will always be loved by audiences worldwide  the movie was amazing

this movie rocked me to my core    i went into this expecting a lighthearted shrekuniverse kind of comedy packed movie as the first puss in boots nothing too serious nothing too brilliant but funny enough that it would keep be busy for an hour and a half    i was gravely mistaken and i greatly underestimated this film    it was packed full of comedy but it was also very serious in the crucial moments that needed it not only that but it was absolutely brilliant everything from the animation and effects to the voice talents it was quite literally brilliant on my first watch i was in a nearly empty movie theatre save for about 10 other people and i cried my heart out at 2 very distinct scenes and then a third time when the lights in the theatre came back on as i realized that this moment me enjoying this incredible cinematic experience was over so what did i do  i went back to the theatre two days later and rewatched it and then i watched it a third time i watched this movie in theatres three times within the same week and yes i cried those other times i watched it too    i could go on and on about how great this movie is but i dont want to spoil anything and id rather people go watch it themselves    please go see it you will not be disappointed

i wish i was lying when i say this is the best movie ive seen in a while i went with a friend as a joke just hoping for something halfdecent and was shocked at how much i genuinely enjoyed it the animation was beyond incredible specifically during fight sequences but also just in general dreamworks has been hitting it out of the park recently as far as animation goes and this may be their best yet i expected a cute but corny kids movie and got a commentary on embracing life in all of its brevity the protagonists story line was devastating the villain was terrifying i laughed out loud and cried multiple times and walked out of the theater wanting to be a better person the visuals the voice acting the story line theres nothing wrong with this movie i have never called a movie perfect before but that is exactly what puss in boots the last wish is

this movie is the bomb     for one this movie handles serious topics such as anxiety and death very maturely and isnt all in your face about best of all it doesnt degrade or ruin the character in any way it gives actual character development and makes it so relatable to watch    two this movie has great characters with depth and deeper layers that help make them more likable and better to see for example goldilocks wanted a family of her own blood but throughout the film she realizes that she didnt need a family like that and finally learned a family is connected by love rather than dna now that is depth right there    three the animation is amazing it is so refreshing to see dreamworks step out of their comfort zone in animation and try a new style to a point where everything is more vivid and colorful instead of the typical semirealism we see in dreamworks films    four it has a great villain i know it may sound like a notsobig deal at first but once you really think about the villain is always the hardest character to write and organize because everyone has a different idea of a villain and how they can give audiences a fearful presence well death was a perfect example of a villain because he was bigger and felt thrill in being the bigger person and scaring puss plus his whistle of death is terrifying and can absolutely be frightening to both puss and the audience the writers also were so good in giving death a vibe that communicated clearly to the audience that in a way he was there and he knew that puss was foolishly wasting his lives     fifth it gives a fresh breath of air to character tropes that are rarely used today and actually makes them wellwritten jack horner is a very good example of that because he is a psychopath who is beyond redeeming and chooses to be evil and blunt with his motives instead of relying on a tragic backstory to back him up that my friend is how you make a good unapologetically evil villain no relatable no tragedy just a fun but psychotic villain     and finally the voice acting i love how dreamworks actually doesnt rely on famous people to boost their film but rather on them boosting it on honest work and good writing like any decent movie should do the voice actorsactresses all did an amazing job in delivering the right presence into each character only seen through concept work and that my friends is difficult to achieve so a very big round of applause to them    so overall this film is amazing genius and very original and groundbreaking with its mix of animation but maturity and i hope dreamworks can continue making masterpieces such as this and that these guys are currently celebrating their victory at the box offices so parents kids and teens please watch this film it is gorgeous and so wellwritten i loved it so much and very much must you love it too d
this movie takes everything that was amazing in the bad guys and somehow makes it all better

one of the best movies ive seen in a long time and maybe im biased because i struggle with my own mortality and death but it does talk about this topic in a way that not only reignited my own passion for life but also covered themes and topics i feel many people can resonate with in a way that is easy to digest and sit with the animation is beautiful something i hope dreamworks carries on for more cartoony movies in the coming years and is very colorful and atmospheric when it needs to be the bad guys all correspond with differing antagonist tropes in ways that feel seamless allowing them and their stories to not overlap in ways that feel forced not to mention we get to see the classic shrek2esque spin by taking known fairytales and giving them modern twists extremely excited to see where dreamworks goes from here and with el gato con botas

as someone who deals with anxiety every day this movie didnt just hit home with me it dragged me into my bedroom and beat the living soul out of me the animation is stunning and the art style is somehow better than the dreamworks movies before it the story has an excellent execution with a hilarious main villain and a terrifying force of nature thats the very symbol of death the main cast are enjoyable to watch as they make their way through the plot one of the characters was surprisingly enjoyable since they first seem like theyd be an annoying comedy relief only to be one of the best characters    overall im going to watch this as many times as ive seen shrek and shrek ii with just how good this movie is this is the second best sequel dreamworks has ever produced

hilarious but serious when it needed to be serious i didnt watch the original puss in boots and ive forgotten the plots of the shrek sequels but it was enjoyable and not confusing at all you could take your kids to see this without having to rent the entire shrek franchise for them beforehand i like how the animation was more cartoony stepping away from the uncannily realistic style of past shrek movies the voice acting was also great every character has a pretty distinct accent but not to the point where it feels mocking or grating and the celebrity voice actors dont feel like theyre just there to pull in a bigger audience the theme of the movie that we cant escape from death but shouldnt spend every moment fearing it is something i needed when i was younger too many family movies are afraid to talk about death so i enjoy the recent trend in animation where this topic is thoroughly addressed instead of avoided overall a great movie made with heart and a sequel that isnt a soulless cash grab

surprisingly delightful entry in the franchise thanks to a superb vocal cast rich story and gorgeous animation  antonio banderas remains superb in the title role this time giving a rich performance as puss is now in fear of death despite years of heroics  he is matched by the rest of the cast particularly selma hayek at kitty softpaws and florence pugh as goldilocks  behind the camera directors joel crawford and januel mercado direct a rich story dealing with death and what it means to live  they also use the allegory of a wish effectively showing how all those seeking it already have what they want already if they would just look for it  it is matched by some gorgeous animation blending cgi with 2d in a brilliant way making for some fantastic action and set pieces  all in all a fantastic film and one of the best of 2022

easily the best animated movie of the year the story  is surprisingly mature with puss struggling with his  mortality and its not shying away from shocking scenes or heartwrenhing moments the animation is stellar spiderverses influence on modern animation is nothing other than magical plus the movie is really funny just like you would want it it from a shrek movie id say this is the best movie in the shrek saga since shrek 2 and i cant wait for more of the franchise in the future

here it is the masterpiece ive been waiting for the last few years finally someone reminded the giant studios how movies are made the animation is incredible dreamworks decided to change the style of the cartoon for the better and they succeeded the comic book style of spiderman spiderman into the spiderverse and a bit of anime animation wink at the cat the cartoon has enough morals so you will have a lot to think about after watching it and the main antagonist is one of the best antagonists in cartoons in general his movements look and charisma make you scared the sequel does not depend on the events of the first part and the series of shrek cartoons it tells a new story on its own about a wellknown fairytale character who having spent his 8 lives is afraid to lose his last one running away from death itself visually the cartoon is bright and fabulous it was very unexpected that the director of the failed projects trolls and the croods a new era joel crawford was able to make this masterpiece and wipe disneys nose so i recommend it to everyone

this movie is top tier dreamworks easily the 2nd best movie in the shrek franchise    the comedy action and animation style are what sets this movie apart from any other average babysitting movie    impressively there are some moments of real dread and the build of of suspense is done very well     an amazing cast really helps here too nobody is phoning it in very good performances from antonio banderas and salma hayek

as the movie has relied heavily on wordofmouth i went into the theatre expecting a lot puss in boots the last wish delivered above and beyond my expectations with its trademark selfaware humor dating from the shrek franchise that has kept up with the times   however what makes the movie a stellar contribution to cinema is the way it was able to through its surprisingly imperfect hero communicate mental health topics to viewers of all ages and in a 102minute format present a character arc of a depth and significance somewhere between zuko atla and wolverine logan  an amazing achievement at reviving and modernizing a beloved franchise by dreamworks and an absolute mustsee

i remember watching the first one and totally forgot what it was about by the time this movie came out didnt have any high expectations at first and wow was i in for a surprise this film is my alltop favorite of 2022 the animation the story the characters nothing seemed shoehorned here even the spanish lines which i have little knowledge of  didnt detract from my experience but rather added to it this is a spanishbased fairytale so it makes sense for me the main villain in this film is the protagonist himself puss own arrogance catches the attention of our supposed villain death disguised as the big bad wolf who gives puss a boot of reality and makes him realize that he squandered his past 8 lives the film does a great job of evoking fear every time death appears on screen the movie also tends to very effectively tug at your heartstrings here and there one such moment is towards the end when baby bear thanks his sister goldilocks for saving his life and afterwards when they all give a heartwarming family hug my favorite character has to be perrito he isnt exactly your average comicrelief as the film superbly depicts him as a supportive sidekick hes an extremely likable character great great film overall i hope this does well in the box office because i would certainly like to see more subsequent films in this series

i thought the movie would be cashgrab or bad at first but i underestimated it by so many levels the story the characters and themesmorals were exellently executed    the main characters felt alive to me but puss extreme fears of death felt absolutely real and perfectly captures the main themes of this movie mortality and death stating that death and mortality is something no one can ever escape from but living to fullest and cherishing every moment in life will be worth it    not just that but talk about the animation style heavily inspired by spiderman into the spiderverse 2018 but made into something of their own super awsome super dynamic and very cartoony    one of the best movie to emerge from 2022 highrecommendation

i thought the first movie was meh okay so i was expecting a funyetmediocre sequel that hopefully wasnt too cringy my mistake this is one of those movies where the sequel is so much better than the original and i loved everything about it the updated animation style is awesome the characters are all endearing and interesting even the ones i thought would be annoying turned out to be great the story is engaging and well written  and can i just say both villains in this movie are incredible a movie about heroes needs good villains and where so many recent movies have failed this movie succeeds big time     i was a bit nervous when i realized they were starting to follow the marvel formula of chase the glowything  but i ended up loving the concept of the star map and the deeper meaning it had towards revealing character motivations without every little thing having to be spelled out in an exposition dump simply brilliant storytelling     animation continues to be one of my favorite mediums for storytelling maybe because it always feels more thought out maybe because the blend of humor heart and action is more seamless in animation puss in boots the last wish truly stands out as spectacular and i highly recommend it

visually a very beautiful movie i really enjoyed the punchy action sequences as well they dropped the frame rate for some of puss battles and it makes for a very comicbook feel like into the spiderverse    the story had a good balance between cute fairytale whimsy and stakes that felt real i think this movie did a much better job than most other childrens movies with themes about death trust and the idea that love is what makes life worth living the characters were also very welldone and i enjoyed the introduction of several new characters which were really new faces put to old characters     honestly i would love to see dreamworks make more fairytale spinoffs i dont say this lightly puss in boots the last wish has restored my trust with their ability to make the next shrek an enjoyable story

when i saw there was a sequel released to puss in boots i didnt think much of it just like many other people i assume at least man was this movie a huge surprise and honestly a fantastic expierence the first is the visuals wich are obviously fantastic with inspirations from spider verse and a continuation of what bad guys first looked like the colors pop and puss looks better than ever before the story is mainly about how puss has selfishly gone trough 8 of hes 9 lifes how clever honesly and now puss must take good care of his last live this makes for a great foundation for character growth and boy does he get trough that mainly with the help of death yes the litteral characterisation of the death who is a wolf who follows puss around making him nervous and anxious everytime he does hes signiture wistle with other fairytales and nursery rhymes like goldilocks and the three bears and the main villian jack horner everyone wants to have a map that leads to one wish wich can be whatever you want we also see the return of kitty softpaws who also get more development than ever with the two main characters and the addition of perrito wich is a lovely way to optimistic dog serving as a great friend and character they all fight for that last wish i wont spoil the ending but that might geniunely be one of the best endings ever to a film this is a great movie that talks about important topics such a trauma trust issues and the realisation you also one day will die and that that thought is okay to have sometimes a movie that has so little wrong that i cannot think of a single thing that geniunely bothered me or limited the expierence truly a near perfect movie and that is insane to think about but i am really happy that it is

i went to see puss in boots the last wish with my fiancé and was expecting an average family movie but i what i got was a beautifully animated film with amazing characters and themes the movie tackles the heavy topic of death in a way that is appropriate and relatable for people of all ages and walks of life my favorite parts of the movie were the antagonists specifically how they use three different villain types without any of them clashing even as an adult the wolf antagonist gave me chills the relatable villain had an amazing redemption arc as part of the movies b plot i could say plenty more about puss character development but ill leave that to the movie itself this movie is a must see

this is one of the best movies ive ever seen and i just want you to know if you havent watched this film yet do it you wont regret it 1010 masterpiece the animation is flawless and reminds me a lot of spiderverse with some characters having smooth movement while the others have a slower fps the battle scenes are really good and have a charm to them that if theres a battle scene you know your gonna enjoy it  now there are spoilers in this last section so leave if you havent watched the movie yet the characters are great and so is the character development puss going from a fearless badass that laughs in the face of death to someone who is deeply scared of dying and losing his friends now im gonna get this out of the way death is an amazing character cuz he is always at the back of your mind like what is that really scary death wolf that wants to murder puss doing right now while they fight or just talk but there are thoose small reminders that yes the plot should be moving yes the plot is important yes puss needs to hurry before he dies and theese reminders come in the little whistle of death while he appears somewhere either behind or somewhere near puss death really puts some emotional connection with puss and even the audience always fearing him the fact that puss bleeds in the first interaction with death sets the boundaries of the film going forwards like it isnt this is a kid friendly cute chirldrens film to we arent scared of doing anything and you cant except the obvious 1010 film i dont usually do reviews but dang this movie is really fucking good go watch it now

handling its themes maturely without feeling overtly edgy mainly just tastefully done if you will yes i am indeed talking about the sequel to a spinoff of one of the mostmemed movie franchise in pop culture the dog sidekick felt like he might get annoying but seems to be the best take on the naïve sidekick in a film like this in a while and the wolf antagonist if your kids are easily frightened by a movie like caroline not too long ago maybe second guess bringing them but if they handled that well and enjoyed that film overall i encourage you to take them to see this puss in boots is the perfect flawed role model and what i said about handled maturely yes this movie has a message great for even the adults maybe even especially so

this movies a mustsee if you liked the first two shrek movies if youre really cool and have good taste it expertly embodies the spirit dreamworks had in its early days that made it special the movie puts entertaining spins on familiar stories similar to the takes on fairy tale characters in shrek as well as creating a memorable plotline with interesting characters that reminded me of kung fu pandas storytelling    the movies story is also surprisingly deeply mature it tackles subjects like anxiety and valuing life in a way thats both intellectual enough to carry thoughtful messages and emotional enough to connect audiences with the characters and make you care about them    there wasnt a single time in this movie where i regretted watching it or wished i was doing something else its fun thoughtprovoking and doesnt overstay its welcome

eu devo começar falando da animação joel crawford faz um ótimo trabalho ao mesclar 2d com 3d trazendo o mesmo efeito visual de homem aranha no aranhaverso 2018 gato de botas trás o retorno triunfal de personagens que amamos como kitty pata mansa salma hayek o protagonista gato de botas antônio bandeiras e nos apresenta a perrito harvey guillén um cachorrinho abandonado que é impossível não se apaixonar além de trazer a essência da dreamworks e da franquia shrek novamente brincando com contos de fadas e trazendo grandes referências e apresentando cachinhos dourados florence pugh e os ursos o grilo falante e inclusive um vilão completamente arrepiante e macabro e que transmite medo a última vez que a dreamworks fez isso foi em 2014 em como treinar o seu dragão 2 com drago sanguebravo gato de botas 2 o último pedido é um presente para as famílias crianças e fãs de animação em 2023 se você vai assistir em 3d compensa muito o roteiro e a mensagem que o filme transmite são excelentes e ainda vem com um musical divertido de se assistir e com uma surpresa incrível no final     i should start by talking about animation joel crawford does a great job of mixing 2d with 3d bringing the same visual effect as spiderman into the spiderverse 2018 puss in boots brings the triumphant return of characters we love such as kitty pata mansa salma hayek the protagonist puss in boots antônio bandeiras and introduces us to perrito harvey guillén an abandoned puppy who is impossible not to fall in love with besides of bringing the essence of dreamworks and the shrek franchise again playing with fairy tales and bringing great references and featuring goldilocks florence pugh and the bears the jiminy cricket and even a completely creepy and macabre villain who transmits fear the last time dreamworks did this was in 2014s how to train your dragon 2 with drago bloodblood puss in boots 2 the last order is a gift for families children and animation fans in 2023 if youre going to watch it in 3d it pays off a lot the script and the message that the film conveys are excellent and it even comes with a fun musical to watch and an incredible surprise at the end

puss in boots the last wish is a mustsee film for fans of the beloved feline hero the animation is stunning the voice acting is topnotch and the story is both actionpacked and emotionally resonant the filmmakers have done an excellent job of expanding on the characters and world established in the shrek franchise while still making the film accessible to new audiences the humor is clever and appeals to both children and adults and the themes of friendship and loyalty are beautifully portrayed overall puss in boots the last wish is a cinematic treat that should not be missed 5 out of 5 stars

impression of puss in boots 2   dont blow this off  i know i know a week ago id never have thought i needed to see this kids movie but everyones been saying its incredible best animated film ive seen all year and best picture of 2022 got it  then they grab me trembling if you dont see it in a theater youll never forgive yourself  so i saw it and good lord its amazing  i knew avatar would be visually spectacular but this little sequel its so funny so innovative in its animation spiderverse has launched a revolution in jazzlike style so engaging in a story that seems lighthearted at first but really tugs at you by the end  i cant think of a moment that wasnt perfect  thats right  its perfect  i wouldnt change a single frame  every aspect of this fairy tale contributes from evil jack horner horrid freak to goldie and her threebear crime family but everonhisheels er paws is a bounty hunter with red glowering eyes that i wont spoil it for you but the film hints at cervantes don quixote and his helper sancho valiantly trying to preserve himself his model of being a hero but the world is suggesting hes a relic  theres a metaphoric death of the dashing swordsman but something better is born  all the while youre laughing at every scene  its a triumph  special mention goes to perro the little dogdressedasacat helper like sancho panza  this side story of being yourself winning by not opposing victory by being incredibly naive or believing in the best at all times its a masterful stroke that adds to this ridiculously stunning work of perfection  perros animators and story writers should get best supporting actor at the oscars  now get to a theater before it leaves youll be begging everyone to see it as well

with an animaton style continuing the great work of the bad guys and an emotional story about facing the one thing you cant beat this movie appeals to both adults and children as a genuine tale of what it means to face your fears    every characters arc is excellent from puss and kitty through to goldilocks and the three bears  also an awesome antagonist which was the perfect representation of the fear most have    the fact it made the kids laugh and be a little scared without making them terrified and made adults talk about whether they fear death means the story has resonated    watch it  again  and again  you will not be disappointed

core problem was the nightmare material in this movie for younger kids 7 and under  the 2 villains are very dark so much so that younger kids may cry during and get nightmares after watching    maybe your kid is old enough for this material if so please disregard  i have one 6 and one 10  the 10 yr old enjoyed the 6 yr old cried and is still freaked out of the dark now wasnt before      personally i think dreamworks scriptwriter should punch themself for this content    without giving away too much the 2 villains are unstoppable embodied death embodied as a stalker wolf with scythes and a psychopathic murderer who shoots people    not sure what the creative team was thinking but this seems unnecessarily dark and brooding  the sociopath murderer was twisted but the death wolf  every time he appears puss protagonist has a panic attack    as a fan of kids animation there is a fine line where jokes  story may go over kids heads  is meant for adults or times the kids get it and then have a lot of confusion trying to interpret  this was pronounced here  the moral of the story could have been delivered without traumatizing the youngest in the audience    ive spoken to other parents some had to take their youngest kids crying out of the theater many had to deal with crying scared kids  try to sit thru the movie    go f yourself dreamworks

when i went to watch this movie i had high hopes when i walked out of the theater i found my hopes blown out of the water during the first action sequence i was taken aback by the quality of the animation for me the animation was most similar to what i had seen in spiderman into the spiderverse but it was executed in such a unique way by alternating between being animated on 2s for the action sequences and being animated at full fps for the dialogue and subtle interactions the fight choreography and dynamic camera movement while being chaotic never left my eyes wondering where to look     in terms of the story it approached complex and difficult questions like the concept of mortality and the value of your own life or what it means to be family and it served me the answer with ketchup and fries it made big questions easy to understand the topics and themes were definitely mature but would still be understandable for younger audiences    each of the characters were as unique and interesting as ive come to expect from dream works the last wish really shows the difference between a villain and an antagonist    on a less positive note it seems the furries have gotten attached to the wolf character oh well

the animation the writing the direction everything falls in place so perfectly my only issue is that we didnt really get to see much more of goldilocks relationship and issues with her family it felt like it was squished in there near the end it had a good build up but they didnt spend enough time on the actual conflict other than that this movie is beautiful it handles the character development in such a mature way puss struggling to deal with his anxiety and fear of death is written so well i know i wasnt the only one to start crying during the scene where he has a panic attack as someone who struggles with anxiety it felt so much more accurate than a lot of the depictions ive seen before i hope dreamworks continues to produce movies like this 9710

puss in boots the last wish is a phenomenal movie for any audience old or young i was entertained throughout the whole duration of this film from the story characters set pieces and the superb animation i was also surprised at how they tackled the topic of anxiety and its effects something you would not expect from a childrens movie as someone that has dealt with anxiety for most of their life a lot of scenes hit close to home for me and i have to say it was handled perfectly this movie is full to the brim with emotional moments high octane set pieces and fight choreography that rivals the likes of anime shows like demon slayer i cannot recommend this movie enough and hopefully it will leave a lasting impression on you as it has done so for me

puss in boots the last wish is a long wait 11 years from the first movie and it feels like the narratives and comedy of dreamworks has matured as you would expect it to in that time gone are the cheap bits at shock humor that haunted shrek entries and especially tonedeaf in the kung fu panda trilogy replaced with mature humor that will strike a note with audiences of all ages similarly the narrative has grown up a thrilling tale of confronting ones own mortality and the fear of death itself this movie takes risks not only in its animation style but its plot and humor as well and every single gamble dreamworks made paid off 100 fold watch this movie

copyright belongs to the author any form of reprint please contact the author  2yb1ydak from douban  source     the wishing star is a symbol of the fantasy that occupies a place in everyones heart because life is not perfect we fantasize about immortality we fantasize about never being apart we fantasize about never being defeated many of us spend our lives in vain for this fantasy but we dont stop to look around us what is the beauty and truth that is neglected    death loss and failure are all things that we have to go through in our life this story about the omnipotence of wishing star and the nonexistence of wishing star tells us that nothing can help us avoid all these things we can only accept face and adapt to them with the spirit of our heart the beauty of fantasy may not be so good but the real beauty may be in the present perhaps it is not too late waiting for your discovery and embrace abandoned heart insatiable will come back to bite you

an absolutely amazing film thats one of if not the best animated movies to come out in the past several decades the last wish takes the surprising oppurtunity to tackle the struggles of life and death managing to depict and do both justice with the tact they deserve while bringing us along for a ride thats entertaining and relatable to all ages and along for the showing are some of the best villains ive seen make a debut in a kids show in decades managing to encompass several antagonists that are truly evil either misguided or forces of nature without any feeling left out or underdeveloped     the last wish was clearly made by people who cared and a team of writers who wanted to do puss justice and they succeed in making an absolute must watch movie you could even go so far as to easily make the arguement that it surpasses the shrek movies which spawned it

its almost ridiculous how good of a movie this is especially after the first puss in boots movie was largely forgettable the animation is great with the action and art style taking on an aesthetic reminiscent of spiderman into the spiderverse at times said animation might look a bit choppy at times but it helps to sell the overthetop nature of some really impressive action pieces  aside from that the storys pretty good and surprisingly emotional at times and even contains some intense moments that could almost pass for light horror no surprise that these tend to happen when the wolf character see in the trailers appears without giving anything away the story also has a good message about life itself thats a good takeaway from the whole movie  theres still plenty of funny moments but dont go in expecting it to be a fullon comedy like the past shrek movies and spinoffs    all in all i had a great time with this and i also recommend seeing this on the big screen if you can hopefully this is the start of a good upswing in dreamworks animated library

no joke an absolutely incredible experience as well as fresh and stunningly gorgeous the animation style is very similar to spider man into the spiderverse but is also significantly different enough to mean something else to the audience    so many creative choices that span across the whole movie and creative choices that stick to certain scenes are incredibly welldone and lovable the choice to personify death is one of my favorite villains of alltime and he is so well done it legitimately brings me to tears the scene where puss in boots is fleeing from the cave of lost souls and is comforted by perrito the choice to legitimately make a heartwrenching and emotionpacked scene is so awesome when i know that adding a tensionrelieving joke would have been so easy     but its not all serious afterall it is a kids movie but to call it a kids movie is a strawman it is so so much more the jokes are welldone and the references to pop culture not the bees are both cringey and lovable just how i like them the wish plotline is a common trope but is so well done in this movie through the incredible relationships between characters goldi and the bears are a group that want the wish to have a family but already have one kitty softpaws wants the wish to trust someone but through the journey she gains that naturally puss in boots wants the wish to get more lives and to make his glorydays last forever but learns that this isnt what he truly wants jack horner is a greedy doofus and genuinely has some great jokes as well as serving alongside death as a sort of timekeeper     incredible movie the 1010 rating is overdone but i legitimately think this movie was pulled off nighperfect and is an incredible addition to the animated movies world

ill get this out of the way first this movie is fantastic plain and simple its great its creative its funny its touching its scary its mature its intelligent its entertaining for both kids and adults its a goddamn puss in boots the last wish i think we can all agree that this is the last title anyone here can associate with top notch quality i mean its a sequel to a spinoff movie from over 10 years ago a rather mediocre one at that and yet this movie goes far and beyond any expectations and makes itself into probably the best animated movie of 2022 but then again this is coming from a studio that made kung fu panda series be known as one of the finest animation series as well    but lets get to the details first being the animation its gorgeous its amazing how well this movie looks with its spiderverse like animation and further proves how chasing after realizm in animated movies is at this point a fools errand that kind of misses the point of animated movies but its not just a ripoff spiderverse in looks oh no when that movie looked like a comic book that came to life this one feels like a illustrated fairy tale book the paint brush aesthetic looks great its colorful and feels alive its animated in a fantastic way and i think its best described in saying that the fight with the giant from the trailers is not the best part of this movie oh no it only gets better from there 1010 on visuals    now to the characters i love pretty much all of them puss in boots of course takes center stage here and his character is at its best here in terms of depth and humor he is cocky bastard at first but as he loses his next to last life he quickly gets humbled and reminded of his now very apparent mortality and his character goes through great amount of growth its very nice to see his character evolve like it does in this movie another stand out i say is the wolf who i can already tell will give several children nightmares and thats good you know a good fairy tale from the amount of scarred children it leaves in its wake people that made this do not hold back with how scary they make this character he is by far the best thing in the movie from his fights the change in mood whenever he appears and the music that accompanies him he is definitely one of the best villains i saw in an animated movie but i could argue if its okay to call him one but that would mean getting into spoilers other characters such as kitty softpaws goldielocks three bears jack horner and perrito are all very fun as well goldie and her family are a very sweet family that go through their own journey in this and could be said they are deutragonists of this movie i really enjoyed them their chemistry and their sweet development jack horner though i say this he is by far the funniest part in this movie he is a bastard plain and simple and he is hilarious because of it and a certain character that is alongside him for a good chunk of the movie as for kitty its very nice to see her back and her story tied with puss is very interesting and i like how they do not linger too long on her drama with puss and resolve it in a more real way that doesnt derail the movie in any way and then there is perrito who many probably thought was going to be an annoyance but he is by far the heart of this movie and he is involved in probably the most touching scene in the movie you will know when you see it all in all characters another 10 its incredible how there are so many of them and all of them are fun and likeable in their own way    the story itself is very simple its a race to get the last wish from a fallen star its as fairy taleish as you can get but the way its executed the way each character changes well most of them at least on this journey and how imaginative and creative the setups and environments are make it feel fresh and it really leaves an impact on you dont be fooled by the marketing this movie deals with very heavy subjects such as death mortality and appreciating ones life and acceptance of death its a heavy movie in terms of themes but its so great to see that with it it still is a very entertaining movie with many clever jokes great pacing fantastic music oh my god the music is great in it as well heitor pereira did a a job here and colorful world and characters it is a movie that can be enjoyed by people of all ages and that is something that is so good to see today and this movie very well utilizes its pg rating kids need parental guidance in this movie it is not a movie you put on to shut them up you put it on because you want to show them something great something they can have fun with be scared of and learn from and i think a lot of adults can sympathize with struggles characters face in this movie and laugh at the more adult jokes as well overall from story standpoint its also 1010 its not a new story or message but it is told in a way that makes it feel new and fresh and it tackles it in a mature way    as for flaws ehhhh hard for me to find really to me its as perfect as animated flick can get again puss in boots the last wish god is this a weird thing to say maybe there are some pacing issues with goldies story and her family conflict being resolved quickly during climax and one character is pretty damn 1dimensional but i would argue its to add to the comedy and charm of said character since that one is not meant to be seen as anything more serious it is not one the same level of greatness as prince of egypt obviously but as far as shrek movies go or most dreamworks movies go or hell most animated movies go overall its pretty damn close to the top to me in shrek franchise its on the same level as shrek 2 to me and its a high high praise    i have to say i always preferred dreamworks over pixar yes they do have far lower lows than the animation juggernaut but to me they had higher highs with movies such as prince of egypt or kung fu panda movies and the fact that i can say kung fu panda series is one of the best pieces of animation is hilarious and i found their good movies to be far more rewatchable than pixar ones but since then they kind of went down with quality sadly but recently with the bad guys and now this movie i think its safe to say that they are officially back and maybe better than ever this movie i think proves how great movies from dreamworks can be today and i think if they keep on going in this direction we may get more very special movies from this studio and i wish them the best of luck on this road and for this movie to become greater and greater success maybe even winning an academy award as meaningless as that became as of late    what can i say anymore its about 95 to 1010 to me i love it and i think many people will love it as well probably not to the same degree as me but i think this will make your day and the new year that much better its worth your money its worth your time its worth your attention and by all means its worth watching more than once

its an awesome show the animation the sound design and the scenery is outstanding the plot and the execution of the story is just to die for moving sad happy frightening overwhelming and calming each in their own scene so many emotions throughout one story and none of them felt forced or out of place    spoiler warning  some specifics i especially liked   death the metaphor of death and the disliking of multiple cat lives embodied as a fearsome wolf on the hunt is one of the best ideas this movie couldve used the character itself when looked back on is blatantly obvious but the viewer might not even know what they are facing until its clearly told their ambition and huntthrill build a compelling obstacle character who isnt straight up evil their motif isnt inherently to kill puss but to punish someone who hasnt valued their life while they were thrown so many chances to do so i respect that   perrito i dont even know where to start our pup is so blatantly traumatized they dont even notice it the support they provide to anyone who crosses their path is amazing especially since theyve had noone who wanted them up until the movies story they also represent a part of quite a lot of peoples life where they rely on therapy animals to go about their days and be able to overcome anxiety attacks get general emotional support or maybe even thoroughly aided help which a companion can provide the scene where puss had a meltdown and perrito laid on them felt real in atmosphere just as in accuracy as anxiety aid companions often apply pressure to help the body calm down i love what perrito stands for   the animation it is dynamic it isnt a constant and thats what makes it so compelling and satisfying to look at the framerate constantly changes the simplified special effects give an entire different tone to a scene and the ever changing flashing colors make for an amazing environment which doesnt stop moving when a good fight comes up the camera work is so well done its always clear to see what the power of the current shot is as an animation nerd myself i bow to this cinematic masterpiece    ive talked enough all in all i can only recommend this movie    get your tissues ready because youll be in for an emotional rollercoaster

puss in boots the last wish was one of the biggest surprises of 2022 this was not a movie that anyone was asking for yet it was incredibly charming and fun the film merges two animation styles which are both gorgeous and cutting edge there are moments of traditional dreamworks animation and others that are similar to spiderman into the spiderverse    the characters introduced in this film are reminiscent of those in the first two shrek movies each character is carefully thought out and evokes an emotional response whether that be hope fascination or fear from the confused goldilocks to the adorable perrito to the fearsome lobo everyone brings something new to the table    there is honestly not a lot to criticize about puss in boots the last wish the film hit darker notes than previous shrek films and there were moments in the theater when kids shrieked some of the scenes are a little drawn out but the story itself is strong    for those with small children be aware that there is a strong use of hell and some cleverly censored words throughout the movie otherwise the film is perfectly appropriate more than some other shrek movies for kids    puss in boots the last wish is the best animated film of 2022 and the best shrek film since shrek 2 not that the competition is very stiff the animation is stunning the voiceacting crisp and the story is interesting for both children and adults even if you havent seen the first puss in boots go and see this movie you will not be disappointed    also the new dreamworks opening is excellent    best character perrito  best scene reading the map  best quote maybe one life is enough  perrito

this movie was not what i was expecting i thought it it was gonna be a generic side character movie like the first one was but when i saw the animation style i and how it was influenced by spiderman into the spider verse i was hooked this movie was aesthetingly pleasing and the movie premise was actually so good this movie is on par with shrek 2 i loved the antagonists and all the side characters like the dog perrito and kitty softpaws i loved the main antagonists being death and jack horner allthough i didnt know who the character jack horner was he was a very funny characters with his design and the way he acted with no regard for his goons i also loved the way they described death in this movie they describe them as a scary character that has the motive of death will always find you and wherever you run i will always find you this movie also has alot of character development for example the protagonist puss in boots is shown at first as an egoistic self centered person who sees himself like a living legend who doesnt fear death but later when he dies and is down to his last life he encounters actuall death and is scared for his life running away and as described in the movie always comes back for him this was probably one of the best animated movies ive ever seen

i was skeptical for a plethora of reasons about this movie ive liked the past installments and even the tv series was ok but this movie literally blew me away the story is fantastic the character development is realistic the connections seem are genuine and heartwarming   and the actionoh my godthe choreography of each action piece was outstanding and the handling of each characters strengths and weaknesses were fantastic even the payoffs to goofy plot devices like perrito learning dough eyes was well used the antagonists and villains were so spot on and the bounty hunter arch was amazing the first few scenes were so fantastically done that i didnt think it would keep it up through a few sections but it just kept being amazing   it really feels like the producers were told to just make a good movie and thats what they were done i dont feel the hand of the studio in this at all just an amazingly well done animated film and an absolute see in the theaters experience as well  the low frame rate spiderverse style animation moments made me feel like they were going to try to pointlessly capitalize on that style but they really utilized it to elevate the action sections even using the style to contrast standard animation motion to push parts of the narrative and character development fucking splendid film

i went in to this film aware of the fact it was surprisingly good yet a small part of me believed it was just a morbius situation where everyone pretended it was amazing however i was plenty surprised  right from the start you can see how they took the animation from spiderverse but twisted and turned it to create their own version which made the opening fight amazing to watch  the film was somehow able to manage theee villains at once and not one felt too used or under used i will not talk about the third one as from the way the advertisements seem to refrain from mentioning him i get the idea hes meant to be a surprise antag  death himself was one of the greatest villains in animation history even when he only has a few actual confrontations with puss as he perfers to watch from the shadows with his red eyes and honestly horrifying to the bone tune   the other villain is the goldilocks crime family who while at first seemed out of place definitely fit in near the end being a mix of comic relief and evilness while it was quite easy to determine how their story would play out and end they were still a great addition to the story   all in all puss in boots 2 is a great film that isnt scared to go pass the limits of a children film and become actually scary at times while having actual character development for a talking cat

this movie was amazing life changing if you will i was raised watching the original puss in boots movie it was so dear to me so when i heard there was going to be a sequel i hoped and hoped it would live up to the expectations of my childhood well it did the animation is beautiful and full of life its colorful and doesnt feel synthetic or corporate like the latest disney movie animation has been the jokes are actually funny there are definitely a few jokes only adults would understand and they used very very mild curse words but it works the dialogue fits the movie in my opinion and i loved how they also used a lot more spainish in this movie they also made sure there wasnt english subtitles so those jokes are only for the spainish speakers in there hehe me included lol the characters were also really good none of them annoyed me which is suprizing because usually in cartoon movies there is some kind of side kick or something that just gets on my nerves but there wasnt any in this movie the character design is one of my favorite aspects of the movie and the jabs at disney were really funny aswell the story also really hit home and made me tear up a bit since i deal with some of the things that were talked about in the movie spoiler mostly pusss anxiety of death and living up to his legend also the therapy dog reminded me of my cat who is kind of like my therapy animal lol anyways the story was 1010 everything was 1010 and i would definitely watch it over and over again and i hope dreamworks continues making great sequels and movies like this

where do i even begin i walked into the theater expecting a mildly interesting action adventure movie about a talking cat wearing boots and i was pleasantly surprised this movie is absolutely amazing and i dont say that lightly for starters the writing for the characters was simply outstanding when i saw that there was many characters i was worried that some of the characters would be tossed to the side a little too easily and that others would receive too much spotlight but no each character had depth and added something interesting to the movie i didnt dislike a single character and not once did i feel like any character underoverstayed their welcome i also enjoyed the humor many movies targeted towards children nowadays just use crude unfunny humor to try to appeal kids but this movie is actually funny the jokes dont feel forced and i found myself audibly laughing at many gags the animation left me speechless it was incredible not a second of screen time was wasted and every frame was vibrant and full of life some scenes you could see every hair on pusss face and on others unshed tears glistening in his eyes the style was definitely inspired by spiderman into the spiderverse but didnt feel like a copy the film takes that comic book style and warps it into its very own unique version the paintbrush aesthetic adds so much color and depth to each scene giving the viewers some amazing scenery the fight scenes were action packed and well choreographed during many of them especially during pusss final fight with death i could feel my heart pounding in anticipation will he win will he loose the fights keep you entertained and on your toes its outrageously good while the plot felt a little simple it feels intentional so that the movie can focus more on the compelling characters and settings the forest where most of the movie takes place is such an interesting concept the landscape changing depending on who was holding the map led to some great animation and ideas the movie took a huge risk with three main antagonists and it thankfully pulls it off well i adored goldilocks relationship with the three bears and her emotional inner turmoil was a great addition to the story i also enjoyed john mulaneys role as jack horner and while he did feel like the weakest villain he makes up for it by being incredibly funny i dont even know how to describe the third antagonist the wolf who was the embodiment of death the wolf was genuinely scary his bright red eyes standing out against the darker tones of the scenes he was in was so visually pleasing watching death himself stalk puss the entire movie was chilling and compelling from the very moment he appeared on screen i could tell he was going to be one of the best parts of the movie watching puss run away from the fight and have a full blown panic attack in the woods truly showed the audience just how much of a threat the wolf was the movie didnt treat the wolf like a joke and didnt present him lightly he is death i dont mean that metaphorically or rhetorically or poetically or theoretically or any other fancy way he is death this review is crazy long and i am starting to ramble so i will end this with an overall rating     humor 9510  characters 9510  plot 810  animation 1010  overall 9510    i strongly recommend watching this movie it is 100 worth the watch it is a great movie to let loose and forget about boring day to day life too let yourself be immersed in the colorful compelling world with fun meaningful characters great music funny jokes and amazing animation

its wonderful    i like the conceit of two cats and a dog traveling together learning from one another at first the cats crafty combative suspicious cannot believe how gullible and foolish this ridiculous dog is but in time they learn to be a little more doglike trusting and affectionate and he learns to be a little more catlike savvy and discerning its nice     i like the physical gags eg where the anthropomorphic puss in boots reverts to his base feline nature i like the character design of goldilocks and the three bears i think its visually beautiful much of the time    most of all i love the bold thoreauean message beautifully manifested into a literal fight sequence at the end of the film that we must learn to cherish defend and embrace with passion and without fear the one short and precious life we have and stop passively wasting our time away wishing for an easy fix
