how do i even get started with how extraordinary and awesome this movie is it was beyond everybodys expectations in all aspects the animation art style action story characters and development was top notch but what so impressive about this movie that stood out to me was the immense depth meaning and emotions ingrained inside it this movie isnt just a kids film it has deep spiritual meaning and i am sitting there blown away by the scenes and wondering if anybody else is getting it too   the character death is a manifestation of pusss fear and anxiety collected over his past lives in this journey his old identity went through a whole breakthrough and he had to face his fear which he has avoided for all his lives it was pretty summed like a dark of night the soul then there was the character perrito which really shines through the story whom was the exact epitome of innocence joy and purity even after going through such a tremendous sorrows he was still vastly unaffected and is able to keep an attitude of unwavering positivity and lightheartedness that truly is a character of enlightened nature i feel that his had so much to teach all of us that despite whatever that happens to us it was perception that created our reality
funny and sad at times   awesome movie  i look forward to continuing with shrek and co
the movie had great animation and characters but there were some moments that didnt seem to fit in the movie

i made a rotten tomatoes account just to gush about how phenomenal this movie is not only is it stunning visually but the story tackles incredibly deep and profound topics i never would have expected a puss in boots sequel of all things to be about panic and anxiety and existential dread every character is given just enough development for the purpose they serve without feeling like they are overdeveloping someone or ignoring someone who needed more depth for the part they play this movie was full of characters and the fact that they managed to somehow neatly place them all into the story baffles me as an aspiring writer the wolf is obviously incredible and horrifying his presence mixed with pusss fear amazingly brought to life by the character animation puts you right into the scene with them even perrito is a fantastic addition to the cast making him the only character who frequently curses is a hilarious subversion i also think that jack horner is really funny i havent seen him talked about as much but i find his irredeemably cruel personality really great especially since it fits the whole death theme of the movie please go see it in theatres i could go on and on about every aspect but its better if you see it yourself

i know what youre thinking puss in boots 2 the sequel to that mediocre movie about the funny little cat from shrek that came out over a decade ago my entire family laughed at me when i told them i was going to see puss in boots 2 in the theater but please trust me when i say that this movie is a masterpiece for kids and adults equally nothing i say can prepare you for how unironically and extraordinarily good this film is i cannot believe it hasnt even grossed a tenth of what avatar the way of water has worldwide we need to support this movie so that dreamworks understands that we see it and that we want more like it    on the surface it may seem like a quaint little movie about puss and the frankly generic heros struggle with overcoming an inflated ego but its so much more than that without giving away too much puss in boots the last wish dives headfirst into very emotionally mature topics in a way that i seldom see in movies animated or otherwise throughout the film puss grapples with the reality of mortality and its genuinely terrifying and impactful    i feel like this movie really showed off how animation is a medium that deserves respect there are some aspects of this movie that just wouldnt work in a liveaction film and i adore that the exaggerated anatomy during fight scenes a certain redeyed wolf villain and the incredible character acting are all things that i cant imagine being executed as flawlessly as they did in the limitless medium of animation the painterly brush strokes in the environment and characters really fit the fairytale genre i was just blown away by the beauty packed in every single frame    the fact that the pacing was so flawless despite there being 3 main villains and 3 main protagonists to give appropriate amounts of screentime was absolutely insane at no point did it feel like we spent too long or too little on one character and everyones motives and actions felt incharacter justified and well thought out to me this is what cinema is this is what its all about not a wasted shot not a wasted line not a wasted second perfect intention in every moment every second is dense with beautiful visuals and rich storytelling

the animation films of recent have been too safe they dont risk much and therefore earn decent rewards in the box office  this movie however was an incredible risk reviving an 11year dead franchise with a mediocre spinoff franchises sequel film thats nearly unheard of and somehow they made it work  the last wish is the greatest representation of anxiety and ptsd i have ever encountered and thats coming from someone with an anxiety disorder pusss anxiety attack was so real his fear blinded him and the comfort of those he was near to helped him through such a traumatic experience  again the revival of the shrek universe wasnt something i was looking forward to but dreamworks brought their agame the vibrant animation style enticing soundtrack wellwritten characters and beautiful story is amazing  9510 watched twice and tempted to go for a third expect me on opening night for shrek 5

puss in boots the last wish is an absolute masterpiece never before have i ever been compelled to review a movie before but this film was so good that i just had praise it people need to go see it in theaters so that it succeeds in the box office dreamworks needs to make more films like this one    spoilers below    first off the animation is stunning its stylized similar to spiderverse but with its own flair it has a very pastel like feel to it which greatly compliments the fairy tale theme  the action is top notch they purposely lower the frame rate during high action scenes it helps to exaggerate the look of fast motion and lets you feel the weight of blow the choreography is great the very first fight scene is very reminiscent of levi fighting the titan on the rooftops in attack on titan and the action only gets better from there  this movie has not a single bad character somehow even the dog who youd think would be annoying ended up being genuinely heartwarming and has funny moments never during the film was i disappointed to cut away to a different character because they were all good and all had an appropriate amount of screen time the character arcs were compelling the villains were incredible ill get back to the villains not a single second of this film was spent on a character that brought down the experience  this film has a lot of villains you would think that with that many villains to juggle the film would miss the mark but no it all balances out quite nicely and theyre all distinctly different from each other jack horner is a hilariously irredeemable crime boss goldilocks and the three bears have a genuinely heartwarming message and the wolf is by far the best animated villain i have ever seen maybe even the best villain period if you have small children this might not be a good film for them because the wolf is scary and i dont mean that metaphorically poetically rhetorically theoretically or any of that i mean he is straight up scary  this movies themes about death and making the best of the time you have left on this earth is handled really really well and maturely it has puss having to come to grips that one day he will die now that hes on his last life since cats have nine lives he has the fear death in him seeing him grow and realize that death comes for us all and accepting that feels like a major and well deserved accomplishment  while i absolutely adore this film there are a couple cautionary warnings that i feel i have to express about this movie while it is advertised for kids it has a lot of darker themes suggested swearing morbid humor and an intense villain that parents may not want to expose their younger children to that said if you think youre child is old or mature enough to handle some somewhat more intense themes and action then this is a movie that both the parents and the kids will enjoy  1010 stars go watch this movie

absolutely fantastic best animated movie of the year by far even though its a pg movie it doesnt baby the audience at all and there are some real and heart touching themes that all ages can relate to and get behind it is also absolutely hilarious     every character is extremely well written for the roles they play in the film and the main antagonist is a new top tier dreamworks villain the stylization of the art and animation is fantastic as well the best movie from the shrek universe since shrek 2 in my opinion overall a great movie

what a movie where should i start it tells a story of an arrogant selfish adventurer whose ego and carelessness led to him burning through 8 of his 9 lives then going on a quest to get them back and along the way learns that he doesnt have to be the legend always alone always being selfcentered and egotistical puss goes on a journey to the wishing star which will grant one wish to whoever gets to it first he is joined by perrito a dog who despite being treated like crap all of his life is very upbeat and happy and just a little too trusting for his own good and he meets back up with kitty softpaws his old flame with some understandable trust issues but they are not alone in the search for the wishing star because there are 3 main baddies after our feline hero first is little jack horner or rather big jack horner a giant psychopath bent on getting all the magic in the world next is goldielocks and the three bears crime family a smashandgrab operation and a real family as they took goldie in and made her a part of their family and finally no fairy tale would be complete without wolf who may be more than just a bounty hunter the movie is good its really good its really incredibly really good the character development has really advanced in this movie the story has some serious messages while also having lighthearted moments they even swear in the moviedont worry the really bad ones are bleeped outyes the bleep sound effect is in the movie after 11 years the legend has returned hes back and better than ever the character arcs are beautiful with puss kitty and perrito all going through noticeable changes throughout the entire movie and there is a subplot with goldie and the bears and kitty too involving themes of family and trust respectively the movie doesnt dumb down the themes not laying them out like a thanksgiving banquet it shows the themes instead of telling them big jack horner was a genuinely funny villain and even though he didnt have his own character arc he was no less of a villain than the others over the movie is exceptionallygreat with amazing animation fun and complex the stories are very compelling with themes that are shown instead of told like fear of death appreciating your life what family really means

being a fan of the shrek franchise i could not pass up the newest entry  while puss in boots  the last wish does have its problems it is still a very well made and entertaining movie  antonio banderas is perfect as the voice of the title character  salma hayek is terrific also as the voice of kitty softpaws  the supporting characters are clever and well done  the character of perrito voiced by harvey guillen is also a welcome addition to the long list of comic sidekicks we see in these types of movies  one other highlight is the character of death voiced by wagner moura  the writers on this movie handeled the character very well  the resolution with the character was quite good  my only criticism of the movie is its rather formulaic storyline  in the beginning of the movie puss only thinks of himself and could not care less about anybody else  however in time he comes to realize his selfishness is wrong and he needs to change his attitudes towards others  nothing we have not seen before  however this minor flaw is made up for by a well done climactic fight sequence  it has just the right amount of thrills and does not become too drawn out or overblown  over two decades after shrek dreamworks is still able to keep the franchise going with some good entertainment  if you are a shrek fan as i am i think you would like puss in boots  the last wish

puss in boots the last wish is as spry and light on its feet as its titular feline the inherently alluring paradox of the swashbuckling kitty from the shrek universe remains firmly in place 11 years after his first solo feature hes a dashing adventurer a charmer with the ladies feared and renowned throughout the land  but hes also unbearably adorable as he laps up milk from a shot glass with his pinky sandpapery tongue as always the charismatic and sensitive antonio banderas finds just the right tone in exploring this furry animated figures suave and silly sides the last wish expands the roster of ridiculously talented supporting players from the oscarnominated 2011 original puss in boots joining banderas and his longtime friend and costar salma hayek pinault are florence pugh olivia colman ray winstone davine joy randolph and john mulaney among many others they bring a surprising amount of substance to what might have been a purely playful endeavor but of course the fastpaced humor and elaborate visuals are the main draws of director joel crawford and codirector januel mercados film the films aesthetics may rely too heavily on anime influences especially during the action sequences but the vibrant colors and rich textures are a delight from the moss growing on a fearsome forest giant to the shiny silkiness of puss whiskers blowing in the wind the last wish offers a variety of eyepopping details and it frequently features dramatic shadows and subtle dissolves to transition from past to present or one scene to the next but the film also manages to convey messages of selflessness and teamwork in a way that doesnt feel heavyhanded or cloying and the stellar voice performances and dazzling visuals keep things so engaging you wont need a laser pointer or a catnipstuffed mouse toy to entertain you

to be fair the animation was great and there was some moments that made me laugh and the moral of the story of realizing what you have in front of you was noted  but it did make me sad to think this is all parents have to choose from when taking little kids to the theater  the scale of scariness and dark characters tipped over in my opinion for younger viewers and unfortunately the good moral may be lost in the sea of scariness  one little girl who is 5 was telling me how scared she was of the wolf and didnt want to see the movie ever again and of blood on the cat  its all she could recount from the story line and i guarantee it is a one and done viewing for her  no interest in seeing renting it or wanting any merchandise from it  im glad my kids are grown now  but when they were younger the movies we took them to were ones that inspired them and they found characters they wanted to be like and theyd watch the movie no joke 20 times or more  i wish for those kind of characters again for this next generation of you g kids  not ones that keep them up all night with the lights on

this is a fairytale    the narrator states matteroffactly in the beginning of the film and of course youd think a talking cat in boots fighting giant treestone monster while holding a concert is a fairytale right     because if you think so youre wrong puss in boots the last wish is a surprisingly deep and relatable story about the meaning of death and of life     with a mixandmashed version of a few wellknown fairytales the writer showed audiences of all ages some otherwise donetodeath morals that life is to be cherished that the real wish is the friends we made along the way to stop and smell the rose etc etc they are of course not the main parts of the story but they have set a heartwarming ambience to the narrative and did so successfully making it insightful even to an adult    the central piece to the story then is deaths overarching pursuit for puss in boots character animation and sound designers reached for the best of the best in making the appearance of death as horrifying as possible because to puss in boots and possibly most of us he is although he was personified in the film the way different visual elements worked together still made it easy to interpret the story in a figurative way and read its moral that life is to be cherished    the films pace seems somehow rushed but i dont see it being a bad thing fastpaced storytelling does not mean an incoherent narrative and puss in boots the last wish did a nice job in picking up any loose ends before the resolution if anything id prefer its quick pace of narration over a hollywood actionadventurescifiromcom that has a thousand character arcs and spans over three hours    all in all take those morals or not youre still going to enjoy the occasional jokes toptiered graphics design interlinked story arcs and finally that part of your childhood revisited     910

jo and i are not huge fans of the computer generated cartoons but there are exceptions and this one is an exception the story was good funny took us back to our childhood with all the nursery rhymes we learnt from long ago     the cat was over the top funny and the star and the dog who wanted to be a cat were so precious we both wanted to cuddle himher     a cat has nine lives and puss in boots had used up eight of them he had left his feline cat at the altar and loved being the centre of attraction when he did all his heroic deeds     there were plenty of villains all taken from the nursery rhymes and there was a good v evil plot and in the end only one real nasty  the others changed  i wont give anything else away but do go and enjoy with your children  or like us two old adults relive your childhood again    highly recommended to all

puss in boots the last wish is a fun adventure in the shrek universe i gotta admit i have not seen the original film and dont cherish the shrek films as much as many do so i went into this with mild expectations and honestly i had a good time it was cute do i think it was as good as many other reviewers have suggested no but it was enjoyable lighthearted fun that is perfect for families with kids the voice cast was awesome especially john mulaney and florence pugh as the villains jack horner and goldilocks respectively and of course antonio banderas as puss in boots is iconic as ever    the animation here was gorgeous too honestly it was one of my favourite parts i love that major studio animated movies are finally starting to take more risks with their animation style moving away from the typical 3d cgi realism you gotta respect spiderman into the spiderverse for starting this trend and showing that different styles can work i loved that this had a more watercolor storybook illustration look to it it really worked for the story and was employed in such creative ways i would love to see the shrek movies take this on but alas they seem to have established their own look this movie just looked so cool so distinct in its own style it really felt like i was watching a story in a fairy tale world    now of course i have to admit i didnt love this movie something about it felt off to me i couldnt seem to see where the acclaim was coming from sure it was fun it was cute and i enjoyed myself while watching but i never felt like i truly connected with the film the opening scene felt a little jumbled to me rapidly going from a musical sequence to comedy for kids to an action scene and i wished it wouldve let me settle into the story a bit first i get this is a movie primarily for kids but with most animation they tend to make parts enjoyable for the parents and older audiences as well i dont really feel that here  they tried with the themes and the deeper storyline  but it never actually worked in my eyes everything felt very kidfocused which isnt a bad thing it just meant i wasnt the core audience and so it makes sense why i wouldnt enjoy it as much i have to say the kids in my theatre seemed to be having a blast im sure this is a great movie for families with children it just wasnt as good as i was told it would be    i think the movie tried to do a bit of what pixar is known for the whole trying to be deep thing the movie involves puss in boots coming to terms with death and it seemed to be somewhat shallow it never truly dove into this aspect of the story instead the storyline is very linear and somewhat dull where it is just about the characters traveling to their destination and the villains sometimes catching up and then combat ensuing and the physical goal literally being the spiritual goal just makes the inevitable plot point of maybe i dont need the thing i wanted all long and its the friends i made along the way that count seem all the more predictable even puss relationship with the side characters is unchallenging although he is deeply flawed his companions never seem to care about that and forgive him all the time the chemistry of the characters was just nowhere as endearing as in shrek still the adventure was quite fun i just didnt think the themes clicked as it felt like they were trying to be deep in a way that is not as organic and surprising as a film like pixars up finding nemo or even dreamworks how to train your dragon     perhaps i am being too harsh i feel like this review is sounding more negative than anything i really did have fun with it and overall would give it a thumbs up its an enjoyable way to spend an hour and a half the animation was really cool the voice cast was great and man i loved the little nods to the shrek movies even if i was never a huge fan of those if nothing else this movie did make me really hopeful for another shrek film i do enjoy this fairy tale world and the creative animation they used to tell the story

after seeing the overwhelmingly positive response to this movie and all the great critics reviews all i can say is that i must have seen a completely different movie this was not only not amazing it was actually pretty bad im not even mad that it was bad because dreamworks hasnt been making good movies for about a decade now sadly so i wouldnt have bothered to see the movie except for the great reviews and it is exactly as dumb as i originally thought it would be if you think puss in boots 2 is a really great movie trust me the bar is so much higher go watch the dreamworks back catalog pre2011 or pixar pre2010 if you want to watch a great animated movie made more recently check out spiderman into the spiderverse or the lego movie also gdts pinoccio was actually pretty solid i dont want to demean anyones tastes just know that if you love animation and loved this movie there is so much more great things to see so dont set your bar here as for dreamworks i gotta say im so sad to see where youve ended up i really miss the quality of movies you used to make prince of egypt sinbad el dorado spirit kung fu panda 12 how to train your dragon megamind and even shrek i guess these movies will all be remember long after your mediocre cash grabs such as puss in boots 2 are long forgotten

i love the character of puss in boots however when he finally got his own solo movie i couldnt help but find it underwhelming it wasnt awful i just didnt have the energy that i wanted turns out the last wish is everything that i wanted from the first puss in boots  the animation is quick yet detailed a lot of the comedy is really dark and really funny the action sequences are incredibly fast and creative and the movie has a lot of great drama and heart  the movie does have flaws though because everything feels so fast the pacing can often times feel really rushed and some of the comedy can come off as a little annoying  but still this movie was better than it had any right to be this is almost everything that i wanted from a puss in boots movie and although its no game changer it is satisfyingly fun

a truly heartwarming story that succeeds in creating its own story while still being part of the shrek universe the movie is actually really good at building up tension its characters have clear motivations and are easy to empathize with  and its actually a surprising good movie to watch during christmas i know avatar is a great choice for christmas in 2022 as well but still furthermore beautiful animation style comiclike and a joy for all audience ages it is also oddly therapeutic or should i say oddly therapy dog

there are so many things to love about this movie its visually stunning  with some scenes departing from straight cgi to a sort of drawn animation  comic book shadowing and sensibility in a sort of akira toriyama effect great action scenes over visually rich backdrops and ambience the humor was very well done and i found the jokes quite funny the voice actors were perfect and there were interesting nods to external cultural memes that were a lot of fun such as several obvious references to specific sergio leone western scenes and style flourishes and after all any 2022 film that has a jiminy cricket knockoff character with a jimmy stewart inspired voice has something going on worthwhile

what an adventure new fun characters wonderful animation and a unique story make this film worthy of the titular legend feline     i really appreciate the characters especially two outstanding villain characters arguably some of the best to come from the studio ever no spoilers there was no character i didnt like which is a rarity it was also very funny at times i even had to hold back laughter in the theater     the art style especially the backgrounds reminds me of the original way the settings were done by hand painting on animated films such as disneys bambi 1942 this film brings back such artistic styles which founded animation styles that have been replaced and critically forgotten over the last few decades it is a similar animation style to that in spiderman into the spiderverse 2018 yet it was more paintinglike and less comic booklike it truly did make me feel as if i was inside a fairytale world    addressing some fellow audience critiques one villain in particular definitely sent chills down my spine when he appeared enough so that any child might want to advert eyes for a second or two this is a true villain character it is important to recognize that even if a villain may be scary that is the point as far as that kind of villain being in a movie with children in mind if you think about it over the years films have lacked such despicable characters especially looking back at some earlier animation films from big studios including disney therefore this really shouldnt be a factor in limiting any child to see this film under your advisement it is pg for this reason     after seeing this unexpectedly great film i wouldnt be opposed to a sequel or other future films especially with the same style as in this film perhaps even this is further motivation to prepare for the 5th installment in a particular franchise in the same universe

got to see a special early advance screening of pussinboots the last wish and it was  excellent more voice acting gold from antonio banderas stunning visuals took me a second to get used to it but really dig this style and a story that wellexplores surprisingly mature themes via a wildly enjoyable fairy talefueled adventure bonus  for perrito  ethical bug    review part 2  puss in boots the last wish was a much better movie than what i thought it was going to be the movie really does start to step back into the shrek roots and the animation is solid and a bit diverse with acting and direction to pull the feelings into the occurring character development puss in boots the last wish is a solid return to the world that began in shrek and features great voiceacting that delivers solid comedy at times and makes for one wild ride

just saw the opening day theater prescreening phenomenal meowywowey work of art this sequel is surprisingly better than the first from a decade ago i absolutely like this movie especially the hero characters so much that i wish they were real so i could meet and talk with them being a cat photographer at local animal shelters i particularly appreciated the scenes of mucho cats at the crazy cat ladys rescue home where poor puss ended up in and a subtle revelation by kitty soft paws on the sadness of having declawed paws i want to see this movie again and againand again

fantastic animation style with stunning action sequences and beautifully colored moments emotion was well done on all fronts and while the story may have been somewhat predictable for the older audience this would be a fantastic watch for the younger kids nonetheless the story is enjoyable for everyone also the wolf was animated extremely well and its fearful aura was some of the best ive seen in an animated format

puss in boots the last wish achieved what very few animated sequels to a spinoff have done accelerate forward in every way shape in form i love the combo of 2d and 3d animation here the new characters are memorable the action reminded me a lot of into the spiderverse and the overall moral is actually pretty effective only negative it can get a bit cliche in a few places    definitely recommend this when it officially releases in a few weeks     8510 stars

made it to the sneak preview and puss and boots and the last wish is a pleasant surprise of a sequel thats equally entertaining for children and adults the premise and storyline is very deep for a family animated movie which will keep the parents consistently engaged coming to grips with evolving over time as an individual along with those you share your life with that value you and appreciating them as family andor friends is a very profound lesson that can resonate with kids and adults whether in first view or many times afterwards with this well made movie just as good if not better than the original
